review: This TGI Fridays is nostalgia for me. When we lived in Cerritos, this was a regular dining spot on the weekend for us. I have had at least couple of dozen LA Water's cocktail here. That remains to date one of the strongest drinks I have had at any restaurants.  This restaurant is very spacious. It has seating inside as well as outside. There are a lot of things to do at the Cerritos Towne Center. Walmart, Ross and several dining options. TGI is the best place to grab tasty food at this shopping plaza after some shopping.

How long is this place going to stay at this location, taking up good space? I was disappointed with my food.  They charge almost $20 for a tiny salmon (go to BJ's instead for their Atlantic Salmon) and their Cajun Pasta was pretty BLAND (also nearly $20) with no flavor, swimming in sauce, tiny pieces of shrimp and chicken, no vegetables in it at all. I doubt I'll be going to another TGI Friday's again and wouldn't be surprised if the company goes out of business soon.

I greatly enjoyed my most recent visit at TGI's. I haven't visited since they renovated everything and I definitely like to new look. The moment I walked in, I noticed how bright and welcoming the place was. Not some dumpy old school restaurant. kudos on design! I was surprised to see that on a Saturday night around 730pm, there was no wait and no long line (9/16/17). We "called ahead" since they do not take reservations and was seated promptly after our party arrived. Lisa was our server and was very attentive with all our orders, refills and service. If there was any delay in order delivery, she would give us a heads up which was awesome. My brother in law had to leave for a brief period of time (unsure if he would end up joining us for dinner) she she had the manager remove the coke we ordered for him without us asking. When he informed us he would be back and we could order his food and drink, she got the order in for us again. When his burger was ready and sitting at his place at the table, she came back 5 mins after to offer to place it under a heat lamp to prevent the burger from getting cold. This is what I call great service. Thinking of step ahead and always on top of things. Before we left, she even offered to have our leftover drinks placed in a to go cup if we chose to.  Thank you again Lisa for a great night!

Amber: "Like, was I the ONLY one listening? I thought it reeked"? Cher: "I believe that's your designer imposter perfume." Amber: "Whuuuteverrr!!!" ______________________  Two decades after its release this 90's coming of age saga featuring Alicia Silverstone and Stacey Dash proves to be all the more relevant. Not in terms of my personal life.  Ohhh no, hunny. I'm far too old for high school drama, but as it appears, chain restaurants rarely ever outgrow the stigmatisms that are affordability............. by way of mediocrity. In advance know that yes, I drove from frikkin' DTLA to Cerritos in anticipation of an above par experience here. Consider this review an epilogue of "buyer's remorse". Bypassing the Fridays location in Ladera simply because it's out of the way and/or the additionally nearby location in Compton........ FOR OBVIOUS REASONS, I resorted to Yelp whilst observing 1.5 stars to be the rough average for NINE of the franchise's locations, within their entirety. I thought they declared peace in the Middle East. No bueno. Pulled up and while the area this eatery rest within is lovely, upon walking in was I stricken with an epiphany towards why it's been eons since my last visit here. - We were NOT GREETED. - The sticky, debris filled floors were an absolute abomination and Heaven help us..... - The food at this place is something out of a damned concentration camp.  With Anne Frank nowhere in sight I thought perhaps by concentrating things would take a turn for the better. Ahhh,...... no such luck as when the food and beverages arrived (2 orders of buffalo wings, an order of fries, a slider, artichoke dip and a shrimp cocktail......I felt like quite the heifer), to be "frank", NOTHING WAS WORTH THE BRAIN STORM! The wings were rubbery.  Think,.... that yellow chicken that Johnny Carson used to keep behind his desk for gag relief.  Was this a joke??? Did I stumble into some bad lighting??? No seriously. EVERYTHING we were served was either lukewarm or seemed to be someone else's reheated leftovers​. The artichoke dip was more evocative of hummus and the chips were stale. To further it, you know THE STRUGGLE IS REAL when the shrimp cocktail is the WARMEST portion of your entire damned meal!!!! With this derived a discussion. AS IT APPEARS, SERVING LUKEWARM, LACKLUSTER PROVENDER IS THE COMMON DENOMINATOR BETWEEN ALL OF THE TGI FRIDAY'S LOCATIONS I'VE EVER VISITED! From Ladera throughout Rancho Cucamonga and San Bernardino, it's as if employees are trained to stand idly while text messaging and scratching their asses to allow one's food time enough to chill and congeal, prior to popping out of hibernation just in time enough to present it to guests prior to their having collapsed from undeniably preventable starvation. Note: THE ONLY REASON WHY this joint is receiving 2 stars as opposed to the bare minimum is because I believe in reviewing fairly and our server, Donnie, proved to be the "Baldwin" of this booze brothel as he scurried to and fro throughout our session of dining, in a semi-bionic manner while serving EVERY table within the bar portion of the ENTIRE establishment. * Simply put, THIS GUY DESERVES A DAMNED RAISE! Upon receiving it, I'd recommend he quit. Donnie take my advice, accept the pay increase, leave and do something good for humanity! At the end of the day, $12 endless apps and/or late night "Happy Hour" or not, it all just as easily boils down to one inevitable conclusion: ___________________________ Cher:  "TGI Friday's is a full-on Monet." Tai:  "What's a monet?" Cher: "It's like a painting, see? From far away, it's OK, but up close, it's a BIG OLE' MESS!" ____________________________ Verdict: [---- I will never....... repeat NEVERRRR patronize another gaht' damned, God forsaken TGI Friday's as long as the fart stenched Southern California air continues to pollute my already 2nd hand nicotine exposed lungs!----] Why you ask? . . . Well isn't it obvious?  TGI FRIDAY'S IS TOTALLY CLUELESS!
Hey I truly understand fish has bones, every bite is annoying, told the waitress I would like to change my order, she just took my plate and walked away , has not returned yet !

We come to this Friday's sometimes and go to the one in Long Beach Towne Center as well. My Reviews for Friday's are...good. The food, service, and cleanliness are typically good. Not great but good, across the board. Friday's is our new "Go-To" Place for Happy Hour. Check it out, cheaper food and $6 for a NINE ounce glass of wine. And not from a short list, but any wine on the list is 6 bucks a glass for nine ounces. That is the bomb!! So first we went to the one in Long Beach Towne Center and they were out of my wife's favorite wine (Second time) and because it was Mother's Day we decided to go to Cerritos. How Serendipitous!! Jasmine was our waiter. We had the Fried Mozzarella Appetizer to start. This was a REALLY good example on how to do fried cheese right. It was hot, fresh and crispy. The cheese was melty and gooey and tasty.The marinara had a nice flavor as well. Next we had the Nachos. They were good. I would order them again. There was plenty of cheese and toppings. We asked for extra jalapeños and they were pretty generous with those. So Nachos were good too. But today was different. Jasmine we our waiter! Jasmine was the best waiter we have ever had in a Friday's - and many other places for that matter. She was friendly, genuine, caring and prompt. She looked at you in the eyes and smiled and paid attention. She checked back regularly and had conversation with us - unlike some of the "Service Robots." The service on this day was AWESOME. I even spoke to the Manager on Duty to compliment Jasmine. Having been a restaurant manager in one of my previous lives I know most of the time you get called to a table it is not for pleasant news. This time was different. Thank you, Jasmine, for a GREAT Friday's Experience.

It doesn't matter the place of business or what they are serving, I am a firm believer in customer satisfaction and service is a top priority.  As empty as it was when we arrived, it should NOT have taken that long to receive our food. Then we finally get our appetizer and entree and it's cold. :-/  You can imagine our disappointment. I know that this place isn't a gourmet restaurant, but they can at least serve the guests as if they want us to come back.

First timer for TGIF, came here on Christmas, went to check in on the waiting list, one of the employee there just put our name on a random piece of paper, waited for 20mins, ask another employee if our name has been called, he said our name wasn't even on the list... got our name on the list, waited another 20mins to be seated, ordered drinks and food, food didn't come out for at least another 30mins.. ate my food in disappointment, was ready to pack my food and leave when it arrived, dont think I'll be coming back to TGIF ever again, food portion was small, for the price you're paying, rather go to BJ's with better service and food portion.

1st Server never cleared the table while we were eating unless we asked.  I never receive food cold and cheese unmelted when served on a sizzling skillet.  What put it over the top was when did they start charging you $3 to sing happy Birthday and not even  tell you there was a charge.

Not one to write bad about any business but guys the food was just not good at all especially for the price. The food looked unappetizing and the taste was equally bland. Service was as just okay.  Just checked out the reviews which I should have done before going in. I noticed most of the one star reviews being moved to not recommended reviews. Will be on lookout for mine though.  A huge mistake coming here. Would have had better food at lower price at other restaurants in Cerritos.

Went yesterday and I wasn't too happy. They took a little while to seat my son and I. There were no utensils on the table and I didn't notice til I got my food, I had to wait 10-15 mins for the waitress to come out of the back area to ask her for some.  She kept disappearing in the back the whole time and it took a little while to get in touch with her. The food was good but I noticed it wasn't hot, it was only slightly warm. But it was good nonetheless . This location needs work on service the most

I haven't came in a very long time but everything is now remodeled and it's nice. I had the lobster and steak tonight and it was soo delicious especially the lobster tail with the butter yummmmm . My daughter had Mac and cheese and she loved them. It's hard sometimes to find places that make the right Mac and cheese but this place got it down . Also got the spinach and queso dip really good to a must try.
Rakeem is an amazing server! Fun filled and attentive to our big group! Will be back because of him!

I came here last Saturday and had the pleasure of being waited on by OSCAR. He's the best waiter - I've ever had at any Fridays establishment. He checked with his manager, to see if we could get Happy Hour....since we sat nearby the area and it was pretty late. He made sure everything was right with our large order,  for a party of 2 people. He found out I was from New Orleans and mentioned New Orleans East(where I was born and raised) so I'll never forget that. Before we left, he made sure to get my number to make sure my points would be added for dining in. The 1st person to ever do that! Great guy....Oscar Rocks!  Hopefully we see him tonite!

Rakeen really knows how to treat a customer right almost as well as my previous server Donnie. I've never had anything negative to say about this restaurant and from what I've seen all of the employees are respectful, responsive and on point. 5/5 would recommend to a friend

Good place to come of its local and late night safe haven. Appetizers are good unless nachos are ordered. I LOVE nachos. Nachos shouldn't be nachos if cheese is limited.  Cheese is limited here. Beer selection is good enough for local franchise, but the food could use some help. Nachos were soooooooooooooooo salty. Hardly any guacamole or cheese. Lots of sour cream, cool, but you kind expect more than sour cream with nachos.

Came here with the kids on Friday July 28th 2017.  Had the worst service ever.  The kitchen took over an hour to get us out loaded  bacon nachos on the endless apps menu.  When we got them they weren't even the right nachos.  Our poor server had do deal with upset customers while the manager all she could say was that the kitchen was backed up 30 minutes. Not sure why the other sections of the kitchen couldn't help out to catch up or a manager step up and up out.  If your  I'm a hurry I would not recommend coming here.
bad service! slow,slow, slow!!!!!! waiting 20 min,then you have to call someone to help you and then in 5min they finally help you...........slow,slow,slow still watiing

Possibly the worse service I have ever had to be with don't go to the place a night took them almost 30 mins to seat us and not for the reason you think all the servers where in the back no hosts to speak up and there dj  comes on a weds night got the fucking food before our God dam drinks and we order the drinks first don't I repeat do not go here at night

Seven months ago we went to Fridays in Cerritos and had a terrible experience. I'm one for second chances so my wife and I tried the Fridays in Cerritos again. For second time in a row we we're told to pick our own seatsSo we did. This time we were completely ignored. Again the waitstaff walked by us and never acknowledged us. Finally one waiter walked by and said he would be right back.....crickets.....so we left. I have had good service at others Fridays in other states but this one specifically is terrible!

We were warned before coming here that the service was slow. They weren't wrong. We waited at our table for about 20 minutes before we even got a menu. We ordered drinks and they took FOREVER. People that got there after us were getting their stuff while our server was nowhere to be found. Some other lady came and helped us instead. The air conditioners were broken and it was SO hot in there. To get our check, we waited another 20 mins. Won't be back to this spot.

Not a good experience. We were sat in an area that had no server. After waiting 10 minutes, they moved us to another station. Our server seemed pleasant, but unprepared. She brought our drinks, realized no straws and said she'd return... 5 minutes later.  Food was mediocre. 3 out of four had their steak and lobster promo. Steak was actually better than expected. Lobster came without any offer of butter.  My wife had a small cup of tomato soup. It was half full. The bill came and it was $6.50!!!! The manager did take it off the bill.  They were having some type of event in the bar where most employees were hanging out instead of helping guests.  We will not return.

So I've came here 3x and this time I was just amazed!  My waitress was Kristy  She was very sweet and outgoing . She was running back and forth on happy hour and was so helpful . I asked her questions about the food and drinks and she had no problem helping me out. She kept checking up on us and always had a great vibe and a smile . I'll for sure be back thanks to her.  Also when it got beyond crazy packed "let me remind you it's a Friday night " she was really busy for a few min and I wanted to order another drink . But her great friend who was so sweet to help her out was there to take them and befor you new it my drink was ready. He was fast and so helpful. Always had a smile and asked me befor I even asked him for help. Thank you Nathaniel for helping out If you want  a great place to eat and amazing staff come here .  Thank you once again Kristy  and Nathaniel !

Came here for lunch and order appetizers and It's a pretty good deal. Endless appetizers for $10. Of course after your first round, plates start getting smaller but order as much as you please. My friends & I order about 5 rounds of appetizers and tried everything on the the menu, from wings, dumplings  to meatballs. My favorite thing on the menu were the wings, hot sauce & BBQ.  We each pay less than $20 and we all came out like a thanksgiving turkey (stuffed)

Our family of 3 will never return to this location. This was our first & last visit here. Last night we had a family date night with my husband & daughter, starting off with dinner at this location. It took 10 minutes before the waitress took our drink order, another 17 minutes for her to return to take our food order. So 27 minutes of sitting at the table BEFORE ordering! I can't tell u her name because none of them were wearing a name tag. She was nice, but very slow with everything & disheveled in every task. She would forget something, then take forever to bring it because she was so disoriented with her job. There would be long periods where we couldn't find her, this was especially annoying when we just wanted to pay our check & get the hell outta there. We tried using the tablet device on the table, but the pay feature didn't work. When she finally came to give us the check, we WISH we had perfect change, but nope we again had to wait & wait. We noticed another table behind us that was SO PISSED OFF, 3 of their people got up & went to sit in the car while the other two waited to dispute something. Let me note that it was not super busy at all, there were only 4 tables occupied on the side of the restaurant we were seated in. The only saving grace for this place was my food was great, my husband & daughters was ok. It was so awful that we will make the drive to a further location next time.
I really enjoy coming to fridays, this one in particular is my favorite. This place is up today, clean and food is very tasteful. I cant forget about the customer service which is always great!

This was my first time at this location, and unfortunately my last.  We came in for dinner & drinks before our movie on Friday & it was a HUGE mistake.  Thank god I only ordered fries, but my cousin & his girlfriend both ordered steak with lobster/salmon. The steak was 100% ROTTEN. Reason why we know, it smelled as if the meat had been sitting out in the heat for hours. The seafood had obviously been sitting out far too long along with their veggies due to their cold, dry, shriveled up appearance. I've worked in the food industry for almost 8 years as a server/bartender, and I have NEVER smelled food that was served to a customer like that. We notified the manager and our server after they finally appeared. The moment they both smelled the steaks they disappeared into the kitchen with the food for what seemed like an eternity. We had to ask ANOTHER server to please get them to comp those plates so we can make it to our movie, and even then they made us wait. We were halfway out of the door completely over it when the server chased us down with our bills. Of course all of our drinks that we never received were still on the bill. So we waited, again. Meanwhile my family is in the parking lot immediately starting to feel sick. The manager was very apologetic but honestly these things should never happen if your managing correctly. Did any of the cooking staff go through the food handlers education? I really hope the rest of the management sees this review and goes through their meat and poultry thoroughly prior to allowing it to be served to customers. Thank God my cousin and his girlfriend knew right away that something was wrong with that food. Sadly they both got sick right before our movie on our way in and didn't even have a chance to get dinner that night.

THEY DO NOT HONOR 20% OFF COUPON (October Deals).  Just finished my lunch at TGIF at Cerritos.  Food was a little salty,  but service is OK.  Our server told us the 20% off coupon can not be used for items from their Lunch menu, even though the coupon does not have any printed language to exclude anything from the Lunch Menu. TGIF should not send out these coupons because they are too cheap to honor them.

Food: good Customer Service: good  Wait: like 5 min on a Thursday night  The reason I'm only giving 2 stars is because one of their Tv's had on soft-core porn. It was a TV show that had a sex scene every few minutes. I'm not talking about a usual sex scene, I'm talking about literally showing the whole action without showing genitals.  Keep in mind that there were CHILDREN in the restaurant. And literally no one said anything, no one thought to change the channel, nothing.  We kindly asked our waiter to change the channel after about 20 minutes and they did it right away. I am just shocked that a FAMILY restaurant would leave the TV show playing after seeing that adult content was on display for all to see.  Disappointed with the lack of initiative/ action from the workers, especially management. Will not be coming back.

Started off good by ordering two new Belgium beers and endless apps. Then when the beer came , I received two blue moons instead. Wow , then I have to wait another 30 minutes to hear they no longer had new Belgium glutany.. omg at this point it's just a joke... so I ordered an 805 and waited another 30. I still feel they didn't want to comp a bottle beer. I recommend going to another location. The food was cheap and terrible.

Bad service!!! After waiting for over 23 min I stopped a waitress to ask if there was someone that could give us some water. Finally our waiter pop up after someone else already took our order . Potatoes skins ere dry cold and looked like they were preheated many times over . I send them back and asked for a bucket of fries 28 min later no fries . I want to get out of here'd and never come back. This place sucks and the waiter is worst ,

The food was startlingly poor quality. The bill for two was $70.00 including gratuity. We drank iced tea, so bar drinks are not a factor.  The Cobb salad, and Rib-eye steak were something you would expect at a low end diner. The steak was thin, unevenly cooked, and lukewarm.  We are currently on a tight budget, but went out for a date night. Time together is priceless, so we pushed the meal out of our minds.

Food tasted like a fast food chain. All you can eat appetizers took a long time to receive and none of them tasted that great. I got a meal and I didn't finish it because it was just bad.  Everything even the margarita was mediocre at best. The bill was 70 bucks with a beer and one long island iced tea. Waste of money and wish we would have gone somewhere else. The waiter was nice.

Our server Jamal last night was great and prompt throughout our time there. So, service was not an issue at all.  We ordered a few appetizers, a basket of fries, and speciality drinks. The happy hour is awesome: half off appetizers, and drinks are cheap.  The outdoor patio is also considered the "bar" area during happy hour so it was awesome. When it started to get a little cooler, someone came out and turned on all the heat lamps and it felt amazing.  The only things I didn't really like were the nachos appetizer and the ranch that we asked for with our basket of fries. The quality of everything tasted so cheap and generic... Just so bland! But why am I surprised considering it is a generic chain restaurant? I've had much better nachos at other places. & the ranch tasted almost like mayo. It tasted like the cheapest store brand of ranch anyone could buy. I was not impressed. All in all, another classic example of why I try to stay away from chain restaurants, particularly because of the generic food produced. I always seem to have lower and lower expectations as time goes on because restaurants are getting cheaper and cheaper.

We sat at the bar area for at least 10 minutes before the waitress came. We ordered our drinks and our food. Our food finally comes and it's all wrong (shocker). The fries were cold and soggy and all of our hamburger sliders were wrong. We get the manager and she corrects our food and gets us fresh French fries. Later we ordered one more slider and when it comes there's blood on the bun (DISGUSTING) and we had to send it back. One waitress tells us we can order a free dessert so we are waiting and waiting and waiting for someone to come and ask what dessert we want and no one comes (not surprising) and so I had to flag someone down to ask for our waitress and she finally comes and we ordered or dessert.  I WILL NOT RETURN UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES THE SERVICE IS HORRIBLE AND THE FOOD IS MEDIOCRE AT BEST. I HOPE THIS STOPS SOMEONE FROM COMING AND EXPERIENCING THE SAME PROBLEM WE HAD.
so it was my daughters birthday and she enjoyed everything. and we also had a polite and very cute server rakeen was excellent at making sure we had what we needed.

WE ASKED FOR GOOD SERVER. Unfortunately, hostess sat us in Nick's section. worst server ever.  Took over 20 min to get my coffee. Appetizer arrived cold. Entrees were good.  Manager and other server more attentive than Nick. Told manager how bad Nick was. Let her know other server great. Wont be back again.  We arrived around 1030pm. Not crowded. Nick more or less ignored us. (90 minutes in restaurant). Took forever for check and to get to-go boxes.  Had to ask him twice  for small  containers and lids for JD's sauce. Food good when served hot.

Service sucked bartender terrible.  It's truly sad when caring about customers has stopped! I sat 15 min before anyone helped me and then I had to get my own water. Manager just watched and did nothing. Great place! Stay out of Bar!
We got the endless appetizers...perfect..price is great..our waitress was awsome....however..yup a however... The parmesan bread was hard as a rock... And the hostess was stoned...she was zombiefied

I don't think I've set foot in a TGI Friday's for years. They got my attention though with $12 endless appetizers. We started with the boneless wings, buffalo flavor. They were out of traditional bone-in wings - bummer. There's an indescribable, natural flavor to bone-in wings that boneless chicken just doesn't possess. The boneless wings were good, but not as good as bone-in. All in all we had the wings, potato skins, mozzarella sticks, spinach dip, and pot stickers. The best items were the spinach dip and mozzarella sticks. The mozzarella sticks were crispy and cheesy, and the accompanying marinara sauce was good. The spinach dip was surprisingly delicious. It was fresh, hearty, and had a nice salty flavor. The chips were crunchy and provided a nice textural contrast to the soft dip. For $12 unlimited refills, this was a pretty good deal. Our server Mike was very friendly and constantly ready to refill our next app request. The only downside was that the strawberry lemonade was mostly ice and they charged 49 cents per refill.

The best thing about this place is the service!!! Great atmosphere on the patio with quality sliders for only 1.50$. My server Dantarius was unbelievable in making my Sunday dining experience both a relaxing one and a memorable one. Would recommend asking for him if you end up here

Just last night I thought i would have a great dinner.  My food was great !  JD CHICKEN w/ that excellent glaze YUMM MY GIRLFRIEND ON THE OTHER HAND, gets the shrim pasta w/ a side of sautéed mushrooms.  Now, when the order came my girlfriend noticed upon mixing the mushrooms with the pasta ( an odd texture to the mushrooms ) I was like no way ask for them to change them.  Are waiter, kind young lady did so rite away.  She was not the problem, I still left her a tip.  Anywho, we thought the problem was resolved, the waiter said she specifically told the cook that the other mushrooms were dry. We got the same out come,  Same dry stale, not even hot, no steam coming from the "" fresh plate "" As I told my girlfriend , being a great cook that I am, i know that was from the same batch that the cook has on the side that's been lying in the kitchen if not for 1-3 hours to make him life easier when those small orders come in.  THATS A GREAT QUALITY RITE ??????  Wow discussed me.  Being the friendly person my girlfriend is she didn't want to start a scene.  So i of course got a bit angered by that but I knew she would then get mad at me if I started a scene. So i then said to myself, we could've fixed it verbally with the manager with no problem not wanting nothing in exchange. Instead here goes this yelp review.  get some better quality cooks, God even Mexican independent joints have better quality.  For the price of the food at TGI , nobody should even have to complain about stuff like that.  Moral of the story.  - Sautéed mushrooms were stale like grilled chicken being left out for a day , texture is like a piece of thin flexible wood.  - Asked for a new batch ( SAME SH*T ) - means cook had those laying around for hours.  ( stale, crushable , no grease signs, no steam from heat )

This was a slightly below average TGI Fridays.  The location was good and parking was just fine.  The customer service was above average, but the cleanliness was a little off.  My water tasted really sugary even after they replaced it twice.  Funny thing was that my wife's water tasted fine.  I ended up getting unsweetened iced tea.  We got the Wednesday rib deal, which was good, and the salad which was also good.  The lunch time boneless wing appitizer tasted fine, but didn't live up to the price.  Compared to other TGI Fridays they are a little behind... though the food was good.

Our server was great and attentive.  Food was okay, had Bacon Cheese Burger (medium well, but was well done) I didn't complain so no expectations there. Ordered up a Pineapple Mojito, had a few sips didn't like it.  Tried to give it another go but nope, asked my date to try and was really sweet.  Told our server it was too sweet and no good and would prefer to just order up a Guinness.    He shortly came back to tell us the manager said she wouldn't take the drink off the tab because we drank half, but they already took my drink so I wasn't really left with much of an option. I'd suggest if you can deny taking the drink off the tab, leave it on the table before you make that decision.  And if the manager is the one to make that decision, he or she should be the one to explain it to the patrons and not relay it to the server. The two stars is for the manager on duty or maybe the policy and or process concerning drinks that are subjectively undesirable, not the server by any means.   The food was okay, not anything to crave over, the dozen or so fries was a good portion.  But props to the chicken quesadilla, that was good.

so this is my second time at TGIF for their endless apps.  first time at this location.  my fiancé & i were hungry after our busy work day, it's now 11:56pm & we get seated. let's just say our service wasn't great during the beginning of our dine in. i was utterly disappointed, & wanted to get the tablet pay & leave.  nothing was going as planned, or ordered. i was hungry & tired but i still wanted things to get perfected, so i kept nagging & telling my fiancé, "oh my ____ is getting reported to corporate. 30 min have passed & still no sauce"  but anywho... my overall experience was fixed, by a positive, caring , apologetic, attentive & energetic employee named RAKEEN!  let me tell you, that if it wasn't for this young amazing soul, i would've payed, walked out & this review would've been 100% negative & straight to corporate. RAKEEN was very attentive and apologized on the other servers behalf, he tried to perfect our experience & made sure he did everything he could to get our disappointment out of the way to be able to enjoy our dinner. im highly satisfied with employees like RAKEEN that bring in their positivity to the edge of the table they're serving to make it a positive experience for everyone! THANK YOU RAKEEN, on behalf of my fiancé & i!  keep doing what you do, you have a bright future ahead! TGIF's CERRITOS employee of the month RAKEEN!

Fries were extremely cold, they brought out my daughters food first when it would of been nice to have our food come out all together. They also charged me 50 cents to get a refill on my strawberry lemonade that's bs it should be free. Also I ordered a turkey burger and it was completely burned. I would recommend somewhere else before trying this place.

Went with the bestie during happy hour of course. Love their happy hour menu. All appetizers are half off except for seafood and the platter. Love their warm pretzels!! So soft and tasty! Sliders for 1.50 are always on point! The jack Daniel wings was tasty but kinda sweet for my taste bud. Had to wait a bit for service. The bar area wasn't full but we eventually got served. Til next time Fridays!

If I could give a 0, I would. Well, a one is deserving, because for the most part, the staff was nice, although they did forget a number of our orders and we ended up having to ask for them multiple times. This place used to be one of favorites to go to, but today simply upset me. They seemed to re-brand recently, which pretty much means, higher prices. For the same meal, you're paying a lot more and the quality of the food isn't even good across the board. Part of this re-branding came with a new menu (looks great) and the like. As I looked through the photos, I saw a picture of some fries that looked seasoned. It got my tasted buds going and so I ordered them (SEASONED fries). When the fries came out, there was nothing on them and twice, I was assured that was the SEASONED fries. Supposedly, the seasoning is plain salt (or possibly sea salt), but no special seasoning of any sort and nothing like what was on the menu. Sure a picture in a menu doesn't show you what your actual meal is going to look like, but clearly, this was misleading. I was upset the rest of the evening. Our appetizers came out after some of the meal, they forgot drinks, the table was sticky and the clam chowder was not good at all. For the price, I could have gone to a much fancier restaurant. Sadly, this is where we ended up. It's hard for me to write this, because the servers were nice, but ultimately, it is corporate that needs to look at this. I'll choose the fancy place down the street. When about to get the bill, my brother asked to use one of his rewards. It was such a hassle compared to the previous times that he used his rewards and the server even asked him to write down the information and left (I don't think this was an issue, but he didn't ask if it was okay, it was just like ... here, do this). At the end of the night, they gave us the wrong bill and eventually had to track down the new one.  Am I bickering? Maybe a bit, but it does take a lot to get a bad review from me and this was one of those moments. Unless you're looking for regular fries, don't be mislead by the SEASONED fries and don't let the re-branding fool you, you're paying more for the same food, which isn't so great anyway. There needs to be more than a new menu and new (higher) prices when you re-brand and this one definitely fell very, very short.

The service needs work. My server spent most of her time in the back area. I would understand if she had multiple tables, but seeing as to how there was only one other table she was serving in her section, I don't understand the wait. It took her nearly twenty minutes to bring out our check, ten more to notice we were ready to go, and an additional five to actually check us out. I don't expect them to be the fastest servers on this coast, but it would be nice to see a little more attention, especially in a near empty restaurant.

We had a great time! It's Labor Day and assumed it would be busy at lunch time, so I did a call ahead and we were seated as soon as we arrived. Our server was Jasmine and she got our drink orders promptly, then gave us a few mins to look over the menu. We ordered and our entrees along with 1 of 2 apps came out within 10 mins of ordering. I kid you not, it was great. So speedy! Since the second appetizer took a little longer  (We didn't mind at all), the server took it off our bill without us even asking. Very considerate. Food was delicious, Jasmine was great, and it was a very hassle - free lunch. Loved it and will be coming back!

The waitress Jessica did not provide good customer service. She seemed to be more attentive to some people on another table that more likely she knew. The food took very long to come out and it was poor quality. It seems like you need to be Asian in order to get quality service here. Than the waitress was trying to short change us because none of us tipped her.

Horrible service they didn't acknowledge me an my party of 8 when we walked they said it was a 45 min wait 20 mins later we asked how much longer they said they were unsure. Half my party left it was down to 4 of us they seated us and had us slitting they're for about 15 mins with no drinks no waiter service until I went an asked finally we got water an waiter about 30 more mins for some food mind u this was a hot Sunday definitely need to work on there service !!!!

This was my first time at TGI Fridays, and i was blown away by the service of Jasmine; the waiter for my wife and i. She did a phenomenal job, always was staying a step ahead of seeing if we needed anything and was a wonderful person who was very personable. Garret also did a wonderful job cordially greeting us and going out of his way to make sure we would be able to get a booth to sit at. More so, he still took the time to converse with us and helped pass the time while we were waiting for the booth and looking at the menu. Rebecca also was helping up in front and was very helpful with a few questions we had with the menu.  All in all, we had a wonderful experience and have no hesitations to come back again!

I came into Friday's on a semi-regular basis.  Not great, not bad.  Last Monday was horrible.  I sat at my table for 38 minutes with absolutely no help from anyone even though several waiters passed me by.  I finally gave up and left.  I won't be back for awhile, too many other choices in Cerritos.

Before placing the order I should have checked the reviews and the number of star this restaurant got from viewers. This has been the worst to-go experience in my recent memory. We ordered food for the office and upon receiving it, everyone's order had some problem. The burgers had no lettuce no tomato nothing just plain bun and meat. The salad no dressing it was just dried salad leaves and dry Chicken on top of it no dressing whatsoever. The chicken wings were plain Bland, no Ranch, no blue cheese nothing came with it. Of course we yelled and screamed and the person who went to pick up the order and did not check all these things but it should have been the restaurant responsibility to make sure the order was satisfactory. Most of the reviews are based on restaurant performance by the server, customer service, excetera . But this time it is a 100% problem with food quality. Terrible terrible  quality of food. Anyway never ever ever going to TGI Fridays and it's not just me it's all our stuff members.

Oh my God ,  worst bacon cheeseburger ever today.  They use like a canned cheese.  Disgusting . Cmon Friday's!! Your burgers used to be great.  What is going on?!!?? Cold bun.. Cold fries.. Terrible. Wings were good though.  Yhe hamburger meat tastes like the cheap kind they use at Burger king.. Wtf??!!

Service was great! My friends and I didn't feel we had to wait a long time for her to come by if we had anything we needed. The price was perfect, it helped we came on a Sunday for half price appetizers and drinks. I would definitely come again.

So we got there @ 7p on a Sunday, requesting a table for 10 & we were given a 1hr wait. A little long but understandable. Our party just hung out at the bar to kill time, but around 8:15 we were all starving. We asked how much longer it would be but were consistently told ambiguously answers i.e. "There are two large parties ahead of you... Just 10-15 more minutes." We weren't allowed to sit at the tables near the bar either because we had a couple underage folks with us. Long story short, we had to wait another hour; total of 2 hours. I understand it gets busy or if they're understaffed, but they should have been honest or given us a better wait-time estimate. Don't lie just to keep our business cause then you get pissed off customers. After 2 hours of waiting we were finally seated... and then after we ordered, it took awhile to get our food too... :/ I hear they're under new management? I don't know, it was my first time there. Definitely not going back anytime soon.

This star is only here because I can't give this place a lower rating. VERY SLOW SERVICE. I mean, really slow. Probably won't come back here and I feel like it's because they know they are discouraging us from ordering more. Have loved fridays for a long time but definitely will rethink that now.
Eating @fridays! On a Friday lol. Overall great friendly staff. The wait was not too long or maybe. Cause it's too early.  Love the buffalo chicken .

GROSS.... SOOO FREAKIN GROSS. Made the mistake of coming here for lunch today. I should have paid more attention to the fact that there were only 3 tables of people eating and no one at the bar on a Friday at 130. Sat in bar area by window. Dirty table, dirty floor, dirty silverware. I ordered ultimate mijito...my glass was dirty, my mint in my drink was all black and brown.... yuck!! We had cajun shrimp and chicken pasta..... it was cold, shrimp undercooked and chicken was in a big ball of drying parmesean cheese...... My hubby has jack daniels sampler which was okay but..... his sauce had a thick skin over the top with what appeared to be a blonde hair in it...... im sure its not ours... my hubby is 100% shaved bald and my hair is jet black..... Started feeling sick so went to restroom. FILTHY!!!!there is old vomit in stall 1, stall 2 is full of human waste and toilet seat covers. The whole floor is wet?????!!!! We sent the food back and left.... TAKE MY ADVICE... DO NOT EAT HERE... BELIEVE THE REVIEWS....

I came here the other night just my boyfriend and I and we sat at the bar area. First, we waited 30 minutes for them to bring out our food and they were not busy at all. Then when I received the bill it was $80 for 3 drinks and 2 entrees. $80 are you serious they are way overpriced and their food is not that great. We went to another restaurant 2 day later and paid $50 to eat including drinks for our whole family which is 4 of us. I could not believe the prices they charge and they have horrible service there not worth my money whatsoever.

Honestly I only go to tgif when it's happy hour or if there is a game on. But today I wanted to grab an early brew. Jessica I. Was a pleasant delight. She told me happy hour was through out the restaurant and thank God because the bar area was filled. Well at least the stools were. I was consistently offered any service needed and she was definitely consistent throughout my stay. Historically I know some servers who would hare to serve a guy who was only drinking a few beers because of the smaller tip I may give. But I gave her a nice tip and will be back again! Now food wise I have yet to try any of the foods besides the appetizers but I am sure to come back cus of jessica. Thank you!!

I got sick after eating here. I should've known not to eat the food after seeing the women's restroom- so gross! No toilet paper, no paper towels, no seat covers, and FECES splattered on the walls of the handicap stall. When I informed the staff, they acted surprised. What is going on with this Friday's? I'd suggest going to Islands across the way.

On Sunday, we had a server named Kristy Robinson!!!!!!!! She was better than great, SHE WAS PERFECT.  We will be back because of her. If ever anyone that reads this goes to TGI Friday ask for Kristy. You will enjoy your time along with the food.

Still at TGIF's with friends from work and having a great time. Nick and Miranda provide fabulous service! Very personable and helpful. You can't go wrong with their "Endless Apps" and drinks! Update - Aug 11,17 - Unfortunately, tonight's service was really poor. We asked for water at least 5-6 times from about 4 different people. Tables around us that sat down after us got their food before us. We asked to speak to a manager, and he got us our food right away. The restrooms needed cleaning really bad. Not sure we'll be back.

I want to know who in the eff hired Rakeen? I'm serious who ever you are - YOU should be fired!!! No joke WORST service ever! So slowwww. Never got refills (He even at one point said oh sorry im not around) um well DO YOUR JOB! Aside from the worst service ever the food was good. The Tennessee Whiskey cake was delicious to bad the experience was SH** I will NEVER go back to this location the people working here are GHETTO!!!
Erika made for a phenomenal experience. The restaurant was very busy but she went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of. Food was great and the service was great.

So unhappy first our waiter seemed like he was on something he never came to check on us asked if we needed or wanted anything. I ordered the jack Daniel Salmon and it was the smallest salmon I've ever seen for a $20 dollar plate. The manager did give me a bigger piece but that one was just as small. Y'all need to change the price of that plate to $10. We had to call the waiter on the machine several times and he still never showed. Ummm may never come back and really like Fridays. Y'all are slipping really

Well, I guess there is always room for a new low. The manager, John, needs to rethink what he does for a living, outside of the service industry, and being support for his staff, as he isn't good at either. It seems there was a bit of a glitch in the monitor in the kitchen, or some such thing, that prevented them from seeing the complete order. That is a bummer, but it happens. John, the manager delivered the food to our table of 5, in a virtually empty restaurant (Assuming 15-20% capacity) When he brought out the food for the other 4 at the table, I mentioned to him that there was a plate missing. Ten minutes, or so go by before anyone came back by, and still no missing plate. John, the excellent manager that he is, never came back by to say a single word about the missing meal, knowing good and well, that there was an issue, first hand. He'd rather have the waiter deal with it. After, no exaggeration, a half hour goes by, I asked the waiter to be sure the manager brings out the missing plate of food whenever it is finally ready. Finally, he shows up with the mediocre plate of chicken and broccoli that took 30 minutes to prepare. pI'll try to keep it short and sweet, our server was nice...but not so attentive and didn't really retain info well. Our appetizer came out wrong, but the kitchen very quickly recovered. Our drink refill NEVER came back which she didn't notice bcuz she never checked back in on us...We had already finished with our ENTREES before she did come back. (Sucks tho, she walked right past) otherwise we would have had the chance to tell her about chicken sandwich that was to have all sauces on the side, was somehow missing all the veggies; lettuce, tomato, onion. I'm sure she meant well, but perhaps the busy day was getting to her. Either way, never walk past your guest without checking on them; oh ....and always bring back the right amount of change, or communicate when u don't have it.

My favorite place for happy hour. Service is always good at the bar. We come for the cheap drinks and appetizers. I like their wings better than most other places. I think we've been to most TGIF within the Southern California Area. Leave no TGIF behind we say.

I went to TGI Friday's last night around 12 for a late dinner  with a friend. I decided to get a turkey burger and when I started eating the burger I realized it was slightly pink in the middle. I thought I would be fine but I got food poisoning from the burger. Never again will I choose to go them ever again. The service sucked and the food did as well. Overall I'm not satisfied.

First off: manager is a dumb bitch. I waited for my "endless apps" about an hr. Everyone in my party received their food and the waiter comes by 15 minutes later to apologize. Even more time passes: no food. When we finally receive the food, we just ask for a box to go.  When we receive the bill, they billed us twice for the endless apps. And they didn't honor our coupon on the bill. After speaking to the manager, she was unapologetic about the whole ordeal but claimed she was doing us a favor because the coupon was expired. After double checking, we quickly found out she lied about the coupon being expired like she was doing us a favor.  This place can burn to the ground. I'd give it zero stars if I could

We came 5 minutes before Happy Hour ended. The manager Thomas rushed over to our table to make sure that we were able to get our orders in. He put the extra effort into serving us prior to our server coming to the table. The environment was very friendly, clean, and the staff members were very professional. The service was very timely and the food was tasty. I would definitely return to this TGIF!

We went to Fridays for all day happy hour with friends. The happy hour was good and the beer was on point, but the service was the best. A young man named Oscar helped us out and we had no complaints. His service was fast and he never let the beers get hot sitting at the bar. Thanks Oscar!

We came here on Wednesday around 11pm. The music was really bumpin however the service was not so much! I don't really blame the waiter, because he was by himself for the most part and had a few tables! But I think that it is more of the responsibility of manager/restaurant to fix that issue! The rice pilaf also smelled like it was old, it tasted ok, but it didn't smell right, so we did not continue eating it! I got the pilaf with some salmon which was good! It was cooked well done, just how I like it! And the jack Daniels sauce brought a nice sweetness to it! Also, unfortunately I don't think that the waiter could hear my brothers order, so he ended getting mashed potatoes instead of vegetables!

Worst service at this tgi fridays location EVER! I understand there is a sense of urgency to get food out to the customer, but the flavor of the food shouldn't suffer.  Poor service from waitress no refills i had to wave down another waitress to get our our server from the back where she mostly spent her time. Once we got our food she just kept it moving and didn't even look in our direction again. WORST SERVICE!

Food was good, Service was good. I've been coming here for years.  About to pay with my 50 dollar gift card (It was the only way I clould justify paying for a $30 Jack Daniels plate) and the Waiteess said "Didn't you see the big sign on the door that said we are not accepting gift cards today".  1. It's dark outside.   2. The sign was a piece of paper written with a sharpie.  3. I was busy talking to my wife and opening the door for her, I wasn't looking for gift card warning signs written on regular paper.  4. Maybe the greeters or the waitress should of said something to us instead of blaming the customer for not seeing the sign.  5. I am going to post a picture of the sign.

No. Don't think about coming here. My dad took us here for a family dinner. I haven't been to a TGIF's in a long time. With a chain restaurant, you would think there would be some kind of training with the staff. I clearly saw there was not and hasn't been in a long time. There were about 9 of us in our group. They sat us outside because there was no wait time. The waitress looked annoyed that a party this big came in. You would think she would be excited. Big party usually means a bigger tip....if you're good. The food was ok. We had appetizers from their Happy Hour menu. The whole time we ate, she never bussed the empty appetizer plates off our table. Come to think of it....nothing was bussed off our table. Our table was full of empty plates, empty glasses and lots of regret. The sad thing is my dad paid without telling us. She probably got a decent tip.  Where is the customer service nowadays?

okay so if y'all ever go to TGIF's, make sure you get RAKEEN as your server!!! He is the most funniest & friendliest server ever (and keep in mind I work at a restaurant too LOL) My coworker & I came here to eat after work & he provided excellent service and great conversation!  everyone should come through every Monday night because he will be here. I am most definitely coming back!
Always great service by Donny. We sat in the bar area and ordered the all you can eat apps and the sizzling  chicken and shrimp. Donny came around often and brought out the food fast.

I came in on Friday, July 28th.  We were seated in the bar area.  We ordered 2 endless apps and a bacon cheeseburger.  The waiter informed us that one of the fryers was broken, so it should take 20 minutes for the appetizers.  After waiting 40 minutes the food finally came.   Oh no, the cheeseburger and fries are cold.  One person received four cold mozarella sticks and I received four luke warm potstickers.  We immediately ordered two more appetizers while the waiter took the cold cheeseburger away.  The cheeseburger and fries were made within 10 minutes, however we didn't receive more appetizers for 45 minutes. The manager  was no help, and she was very condesending.  She informed us that the hamburger was removed from the bill, but we would need to pay the 20 dollars for 4 potstickers and 4 cold mozarella sticks.  She was very matter of fact and offered free dessert as a consolation prize.  I kindly rejected her offer and paid the bill.  This restaurant has lost a valued customer.  I usually frequent your restaurant at least once a week.   Your managers lack of concern regarding the poor service I received was very disheartening.

So let's start with a disclaimer: this is my first time eating at TGI Friday's, and with a party of 16, I'm sorry to say that it turned ugly much faster than I thought. First shocker was that they DO NOT have bottomless fries. $3.99 for a small plate of fries, you would think they would match the competition with the endless refills. Not the case. Next were drinks. I always start off with a water, no ice. I don't usually make a big fuss about ice being in it, but this not only had a ton of ice, it was disgusting ice to boot. I'm not sure what their ice maker looks like, but I think they should check it, and the water lines that lead to it.  And another big note: when you don't have free refills on a drink like a strawberry lemonade (competition wins again), please don't fill it to the brim with crushed ice before adding the drink, forcing you to pay $0.49 for another drink in a few minutes.  On to the food:  Mozzarella sticks were too salty, and the marinara tasted like a funky jar of Ragu sauce.  The burger that I ordered was to be medium rare (which I figured to come out as true medium), really came in as a slightly charred medium well. It went back to the kitchen. Another order had a BLT that didn't have any guacamole. ALL 5 of the smoke stacked burgers were missing the bacon. Nobody wanted to make any deal of it. I also noticed that they were to have 2 patties, but each patty looked to be about half a normal patty. I personally have a problem when restaurants do that. A steak that was ordered medium was med-well going on well. Chicken something pasta was horribly overcooked and mushy, and just on the other side of over-salted. So, aside from my no-ice mishap, everything with the service was standard.  Are all Friday's this horrible? I don't know, but I don't think I'll ever find out.

Great staff and the food was cooked to perfection! Drinks were great and the restaurant was clean! Again excellent staff! Wait wasn't long at all but we always sit at the bar which almost always means zero wait time!  I'll definitely come back to this TGIF when I'm in the area.

I took my friend to eat with me here and we had a great experience. We were greeted promptly by the welcoming staff and our food was served just in time. We enjoyed the clam chowder and the famous Jack Daniel's Bacon Cheeseburger. Our server, Jessica I., made sure that we had everything that we needed before we needed it. We will be back again. What a time!

I'm not necessarily a big fan of TGIFridays - it's okay and I only come here once or twice a year. What drew me in today was the $12 drink and dinner offer. I didn't end up ordering off of that menu, but decided to try the Sizzling Chicken and Spinach entrée instead. I thought it was delicious! The chicken was cooked and seasoned perfectly, and the accompanying side of tomato and mozzarella salad was very tasty as well.  Our waiter, Landon, was very friendly, professional, and attentive; stopping by several times to see if we needed anything.  I may decide to return a little more often!
Waited with calling server light blinking on the order machine for over 10 minutes and nobody even cared to stop by. So my boyfriend and I just left. They had so many employees, for what?

I came here on a Sunday afternoon with a friend of mine and her baby. We were seated soon after arrival and Jamall was our server. I work in the restaurant/food industry so customer service has always been a key point for me. If I could give him more than 5 stars I would. His customer skills were amazing. For all the parents out there, we all know that having a baby at a restaurant may not be the easiest. There maybe be spills and other incidents. He brought us extra napkins and other needed supplies just in case we need it. Throughout the whole dining process, he checked on us numerous times just to make sure everything is okay. He refilled our water and made sure we have our drinks filled to the top. Not only so, the food was brought out immediately so we didn't wait that long. He made us feel welcome and we definitely will come back here again It's hard to find young people now adays who cares so much about his/her customers. The food was great, the service was perfect! The overall experience is phenomenal!  Thank you Jamall! Can't wait to come back!

I have been coming here for years with all of my friends and I love this spot! Megan, Sam, and Victor are always so friendly and efficient every time we come in! Sam has been my bartender the longest and she is so knowledgeable as a mixologist. Anytime I am feeling like something I can't put my finger on she comes up with something amazing and gets it in my hand faster than I can blink. Keep up the great work team Cerritos! Love you all!

I have been here twice and both times the service has been completely mediocre.  Asking for a bill and getting it within a reasonable time is really not possible. :(. Servers don't even smile, let you know they will be with you in few...none of that courtesy stuff for them.  I have been standing here like a statue at the entrance and servers just pass me by, someone did stop and address me but then disappeared with a coworker.  I'm just here because of Paint Nite.  I Will be suggesting they don't do their events here in the future.  :(

met a buddy here for beers and lunch, in that order.... they've attempted to redo the bar section and make it more of a communal dining/drinking pub area, eh....should have left well enough alone, don't really think you should be forced to drink with strangers unless you want to  in any case, there are still plenty of tables where you can have a little bit of privacy.  there are wifi menus at the tables similar to chili's or stacked.....that's what you get for pushing for that "living" wage folks....automation and elimination of jobs! we opted to order from a live waitress, started with a couple large coors lights for lunch... I ordered the Jack Daniels chicken sandwich to accompany my beer my buddy had the jack daniels chicken and shrimp to accompany his beer my sandwich was good, a bit messy, but tasty.  came with fries my friend polished off his meal, which was basic grilled chicken and shrimp with a jack Daniels glaze ordered another couple large beers for desert, and then back to work service was good, food and beers served quickly think this chain has seen better days, but not a whole lot of choices in the area they have a decent happy hour .....forgot, wasn't at this location, but avoid their mahi mahi fish sandwich, pretty pathetic.....

Customer Service is terrible.  Waitress forgot to order our Meals, only the appetizers came out, we waited for more than an hour.  The waitress didn't apologize to us that she made a mistake. The employees at TGIF were really rude and thought that we were making a big deal instead.

Worst service and food was just as bad!  Husbands salmon was over cooked. Plus the broccoli tasted like the bag they cooked it in. The salsa stuff on top of the salmon was good tho! My slidders literally had 3 small grilled onions on them each!  Son got the chicken and fries .. Server came with oranges :/ son hates anything that's not fries!

"It's Friday, Friday Gotta get down on Friday," "Friday", Rebecca Black Remember that little diddy?  Admit it, you had that as your ringtone, didn't you? ;p Happy Hour all day Sundays - 1/2 off appetizers excluding seafood & platters Lunch with the fam on a lazy Sunday.  I haven't been to TGI Friday's in probably a decade.  I do remember being fond of their Jack Daniel's Tower.   Here's the lowdown of what we had (all appetizers, of course)- BBQ chicken flatbread This small dish was quite tasty.  Tender chunks of chicken on the right amount of bread.  I enjoyed the green onions liberally sprinkled on top. Nachos These are mine, nachos!!! ;p  I heart nachos.  Crispy tortilla chips, with cheese, chicken, salsa, sour cream & guacamole.  The portion size was decent for a sitdown restaurant. Buffalo Wings w/bleu cheese These were good.  Not exceptionally good, but good.  The heat was just right & the celery stalks were crunchy Three-for-all (Mozzarella wedges, garlic parmesan wings & loaded potato skins) If at first you don't succeed, fry, fry & fry again! ;p  The mozzarella was nice & gooey, the loaded potato skins crunchy on the outside & soft on the inside.  The garlic parmesan wings were the standout for me, since I'm such a garlic slut.  Who cares if my breath will stink afterwards?  If it tastes good, it tastes good.  I should put up a profile on   stating "Looking for someone to have garlic breath with." BWAHAHAHAHAHAAHAHAHAHA Service was okay.  We had to ask our server for a few things, but wasn't a biggie.  Plenty of seating during Sunday lunch.  Fridays became more packed as we had our lunch, probably because of the football games on TV.  Parking is in the Cerritos Towne Center.  Usually not a problem. Would I come back?  Eh, maybe.  Restaurants like TGI Friday's aren't places that have cravings for, but I'll be a team player and go if other's are in the mood.  1/2 off appetizers is a definite enticement, though! Recommend for Happy Hour Sundays!

It took almost 1 hour for our main course to arrive so 3 stars for the restaurant. Donny made our wait bearable by checking on us from time to time and he graced us with his song. Thomas, the manager is also great. 5 stars for both Danny and Thomas.
The food is excellent, as well as the service! Jessica Ignacio was great, she was always available when i needed something and was quick to give me anything i needed. I plan on coming back again!

Terrible service! It seems all the servers do is apologize. The food took 45 minutes to come out and we had a chicken salad and a burger. It took 10 minutes to get a beer! Restaurant and bar are about half capacity. So shouldn't have taken that long. It took 5 minutes for the bartender to pour the beer after ordering and another 5 for the waiter to bring it! Food was ok, steer clear. They need new management...

Service was terribly slow for not being too busy.  The food took so long to come out and we were starving.  The manager walked out with our food, with a server behind her with our appetizer.  Seriously?!?!  Appetizer was ordered WAY before dinner was even ordered!  They did comp the appetizer and one meal, so that was great.  But I'd rather pay full price for a stress-free meal!!

This happened on May 4, 2016 at around 11:50 pm. Got food poisoning after eating their version of a classic double cheeseburger. It's been 4 days and I can finally say I'm beginning to recover again. Luckily, I received the worst illness. Not my 9 year old nephew and my sisters' boyfriend who only suffered from mild stool irritation. Please take better precautions with the safety of your food.

Came here on a Thursday night around 11pm to celebrate a friend's birthday. Was hoping for a good time, but turned out to be one of the worst customer service experiences I've ever had at a restaurant. We asked if we could sit in the main restaurant area because we couldn't hear each other over the music.  The server literally threw the silverware onto our new table and gave us dirty dishes (we asked for new ones). Not only was the service extremely unprofessional, but it was also incredibly slow. As for the food, I ordered the ahi tuna crisps, which was 4 tiny tortilla chips on a bed of shredded cabbage, with dry tuna and a jalapeño on top of each chip. And there was a random bunch of cilantro on just one chip. I ate the chip and the tuna, but everything else on the plate was inedible. Not worth even the 1/2 off happy hour price. Spend your money (and your birthday celebrations) elsewhere. I'm usually a fan of Friday's, so this was disappointing.
Ordered lunch balsamic glazed chicken salad prior to arriving. Sadly, it took them 30 minutes to make my order. When I returned to work, realized the chicken wasn't even cooked. Really sad.
This restaurant has the laziest waiters ever! The food is terrible and overpriced. I feel sorry for the bartenders because they do a descent job but the waiters in the area suck!!!!

This place sucks, so much because I ordered some food from there and the shrimp was cold along with the cheese too. It was a pasta and it didn't taste like it was cooked, more like it was thrown on the plate and given to me. I would give it 0 stars but it won't let me. Overall from setting this food I got really bad food poisoning and I was throwing up no stop. Fuck this place.

NOT so Thankful its Friday! This place is in one word...OVER RATED!  Ok that was two words.  I have NEVER seen the appeal of this place!  I will give it to them that it is if good for groups and to come in and relax after a long work week and the food is so-so! Other than that I just get an overall BLAH FEELING about this place! Let's start with the service...IT IS SUPER SLOW!  Every single time I have been here I forget what I ordered because it takes so long to get my food!  SO you say that's because you came when it was busy...NOT SO my friend...Once I went in the middle of the week before the lunch rush when they had maybe 3 people in there.  IT STILL TOOK nearly a month of SUNDAY'S to get my food!   By the time my food did arrive I had FILLED UP ON my Arnold Palmer (several glasses) and wasn't hungry anymore, but I did need a bathroom and quick!  SO I ended up having to take a salad home.  And WE ALL KNOW LETTUCE is NOT a LEFT OVER meal thus I basically ended up paying for a salad I never got to eat!  Boo, boo, boo, boo! NO BUENO! My parents have always said this is a place where they want you to drink which is why the service is so slow!  They figure you'll fill up on alcohol which will cost more than food but you'll buy the food ANYWAY because you need to soak up some of the alcohol before you get in your car to drive.   This place is ALWAYS WAY TO LOUD for my taste and the last few times I went I thought I thought I needed a tazer for some of the patrons!  I also don't care to listen to screaming kids while I eat.  I'm guessing the parents don't try to do anything because the noise level is already off the charts at times. I just keep leaving disappointed and needed a aspirin for the headache I got from it being so loud! Maybe I have just outgrown this place or never grew into it!  Either way I can't say I will be back anytime in the near future!  I'm just not THAT DESPARATE!
Pretty good. Average Friday's food. Defiantly do the lunch deal if going around lunch. Plenty of food.
We had happy hour on Friday and it was good as usual.  The service was excellent, Jasmine is always right on top of things!  Also very happy and friendly also.
It's always a hit and miss with this place. Sometimes you get great service other times you don't.  Food is always good and reasonable prices.

The food was average and nothing great. It wasn't horrible but it wasn't good either. The food didn't have much flavor which could be why it came out so quickly. The service was good though our waiter was on his A game and brought us everything we needed and wanted quickly. I probably won't be coming back by choice though. If friends want to meet up here then whatever but it wouldn't be somewhere I would choose to come.

The night was good.  We started with one server and then got switched to Alexandra? I believe.  Lunch breaks happen.  The new server did a great job.  She had a good personality and rolled with the random crap my fiance and I said.  The food came out good.  We did the 2 for $20 and it was worth it.  The meal was good, flavored well and came out hot.  We had the dragon something chicken and the fried shrimp.   All in all a great experience.  The app is also worth it I love my free chips and salsa.

This location needs work... Customer service that's what's it is all about and last night 9/30 I had went with friends, sat down and order drink and food it took at least a hour for 3 drinks and 1 order of appetizers to arrive ... It was ridiculous ! They were short staff which is horrible on a Friday knowing its TGIF !  Never again going back they lost a customer ! Service sucks ... I'll go to wood ranch !

Only reason it's not a one star is our waiter who was super nice and attentive.My food was nothing short of repulsive and inside was overly loud music and outside it was a bunch of people cussing to the top of their lungs and getting so drunk they knocked over chairs.This was all on a Thursday...
