The only reason I'm giving 4 and not 5 stars is because we waited a bit more than expected for our appetizer to come out. Wasn't that busy upon arrival. Food and service were great though. Waitress checked on us very often which I ALWAYS appreciate.

I went here around midnight with my cousin and her boyfriend. As soon as we entered, we waited 10 minutes before anyone even acknowledged us, even as workers passed by us several times. Then the host finally tells us to either sit at the bar (which was full and had no open spots for us unless we wait 10 more minutes while the DJ cleans up) or sit in the dining area but expect really slow service because there's only one waitress. Great choices!  We decide to wait for the DJ because at least appetizers will be half off in the bar. She did not mention to the DJ that we were waiting so he was taking a very long time, chatting with randoms. I blame the host for that, she could have at least given him a heads up. She told us as soon as he leaves we could sit down and after all that waiting, the table was cluttered with filth. At that moment I see busser cleaning off one of the larger tables and dash towards it. Finally, a seat!  Another 10 minutes go by as we wait to order our delicious tap water and an appetizer that is clearly half the order they normally give, it's literally "half off!" Apparently she thinks this is all we are ordering because she has someone else drop it off and doesn't come back to us until we are finally able to flag her down 15 minutes later. We order cheeseburger sliders and a sizzling chicken and cheese.  The sliders were alright, no big complaints. The sizzling chicken and cheese was depressing. It was barely sizzling, the mashed potatoes were almost a liquid, and the cheese was unmelted sliced cheese thrown on. I get this entree fairly often, probably at least once or twice a month because it's semi Atkins friendly. This is NOT what it normally comes out looking/tasting like.  Maybe they are better during the day, but they need more people with better training at night. Don't be a late night restaurant/bar if you aren't equipped for it.  Last bit of advice: Go to the TGIFridays in Brea if you go this late. It's a bit of a drive, but worth it. It's the one I normally go to, but didn't this time since my cousin lived nearby the Cerritos one.

I came today with a friend for lunch and told the server it was her birthday.  We ordered from the lunch menu and got the chips free with Stripes membership.  Each time I wanted a drink refill, I had to flag down the waitress.  My friend ordered the broccoli soup.  She said it had no taste and was cold.  I ordered the Italian chicken sandwich on a pretzel bun. It came with a lot of very spicy jalapeño peppers, which wasn't mentioned in the menu description.  When the check came, I had to ask her to take off the free chips, so I wouldn't be charged for them. I also reminded her it was my friend's birthday.  They came with ice cream with a swirl of chocolate sauce and whipped cream.  There was one spoon.  I asked if we were supposed to share the spoon.  She brought me my own spoon.

First of all, the place is not busy and that should've been a clue. Prices are a little high so you expect a little more during your visit. I wouldn't even consider this average. Our department went for lunch at 1pm. My friend got the appetizer sampler that turned out pretty good. However, my other friends and I got two soups, two half-sandwiches and fries. The soup was clam chowder and it was VERY diluted with water. Not much flavor or density to the broth AT ALL. When the fries came out, they were cold. The half sandwiches were BLTs with avocado. Have you ever been to a fast food restaurant that's all bun and no beef? That's what the sandwich was. It was cold, a thin-thin tomato, a thin-thin piece of bacon, and lettuce, with a very thin slices of avocado. Are you really tasted (and got) was bread. We watched a couple stand at the door waiting to be seated for a very long time as other employees would look at them and walk past. There are no occupied seats, there's nobody to wait on, so seat them!  Waitress was nice and brought us new fries. But I will not be back. Nor will my friends. The value just isn't here. Very disappointed. I would advise our very nice waitress to find a new job.

I couldn't get out from the restroom stall :( A sweet waitress name Corina kicked the door open so I could get out.  Thanks Corina!!  The automatic paper towel dispenser wasn't working.  Please fix your restroom. Ordered Jack Daniel sampler and Jack Daniel Burger. Jack Daniel Sampler ($10.89): Crispy Cajun-spiced shrimp, Asian inspired sesame Jack chicken strips and Jack Daniel baby back pork ribs.  The shrimps are frozen shrimps and they are tasteless.  The bacy back pork ribs are not that good but I kinda like the chicken. 2 stars!! TGI Friday's is not yummylicious!!

Probably the WORST service I've ever had in my life. It took about 20 minutes for them to even greet the table! I've never felt more irrelevant and not taken care of before! Customer service clearly isn't important to anyone that works here.

Haven't been here in more than 5 years due to my experience with multiple bad services in the past. Got out of the movie theatres hungry so my gf and I thought we'd give it a try since it's conveniently close by. I'm not going to go into details.... but the service still sucks. Waitress is very rude.  P.S. as I was writing review laying down on my bed my gf noticed what she thought was gum stuck to my shorts. Took it off immediately to inspect it and it turns out it was the Jack Daniel glaze they use for their chicken appetizer. You would automatically think when they seat you at a table it would already be clean. Smfh disappointed.
Mango-Coco jito was delicious and only $5 Still stand by the great happy hour Our waitress this time was very attentive that they earned another star
Really professional, friendly, attentive & personable bartender. It's bright, not too dark & has a lotsa parking.

It's so hard to even give this place 1 star, but since I'm forced to here it goes. I remember when this place was the place to hang out summer evenings, when they had Karoke out on the patio. In the last 10 years or so, this place has really gone down hill and tonight was no exception.   We were going to grab an appetizer after our movie for their late night happy hour. We decided to sit on the patio and waited for our server. After we sat down 3 men sat down. The server came out, handed another table their bill and proceeded to go up to the new arrivals all the while ignoring us. This is one of my pet peeves.  The waiter came back our and again didn't approach us. So I got up and walked out. I will never go back to a TGI Friday's again.  We decided to drive to the BJS up the street.

I wish I could have given 0 Stars, I can't tell you how the food was because after sitting at the table 20 minutes we left. We never saw our server, spoke to the manager and he did not seem to care. Side note the people sitting at the table next to us also left.

Just left there before we ever sat down.  7 or 8 clean tables that I saw, but yet a 20 minute wait????? Asked why so long and her response was because they were seating 2 parties of 4 before us.....not sure what's going on there but management needs to look out for lazy hostesses.

Came here with my family and it was a horrible experience from the beginning. We were quoted a 15 min wait, 30 min later we're still waiting and people are being seated ahead of us. We finally ask the hostess then get seated immediately. Our waitress took forever didn't bring us silverware or straws, our drinks came 20 min later, she screwed up my drink twice, she didn't bring plates for our appetizers, I ordered my steak medium and it came out well done, she messed up on my sons order, kept forgetting our refills, it was a disaster. I honestly felt really bad for her, she was nice but horrible at her job; completely incompetent. Every time we asked her for something she would forget then walk by and say "oh yeah, the chocolate milk, I'll be right back" then she would forget all over again! It was awful. Our bill was almost $80, when you go out to eat you pay a markup for service but we didn't get any. I feel bad for leaving a 10% tip, but honestly she didn't even deserve that.

Complained to corporate office.  Received an email stating the manager would call me in 1-2 days.  A week later.... No call. Good thing I didn't hold my breath.  It's a shame a national chain would allow a franchise to represent their brand so badly.

They couldn't accommodate us for happy hour. I mean I get it, the happy hour is technically at the bar only... but that's the reason we're here. and if the bar is full, why not? Other locations have gladly let us do the happy hour at a booth. We're still paying customers! Better than having us leave, no?  Tip: Applebee's is also really great at letting you do the happy hour if there's no room at the bar :)

This is my first time at TGIF and the food was outstanding. Not only that, the customer service from Jessica I. was phenomenal. She deserved a great tip, and kept checking up on my table to see if we needed any assistances. I will be coming back here again 10/10
I'm a usual during football season and have never had a problem, love happy hour and those boneless garlic Parmesan or buffalo wings, a go to happy hour spot for me

To me this place seemed like all hype... and for the most part it was. Appetizers: My boyfriend and i ordered the mozzarella sticks, boneless buffalo wings, and the pretzel sticks They were all so good! The mozzarella sticks were nice and crispy and the cheese was delicious. The buffalo sauce for the wings tasted fresh. The pretzel sticks were very warm, nicely salted, and omg that enticing smell when you break it open   I ordered the Sedona Black Bean Burger (subbed the chipotle mayo with regular mayo, and the pepper jack cheese and cheddar for only Swiss ) First of all, it's supposed to be a healthy burger :/ And then they add those two things above plus balsamic onions When I received my burger it was already falling apart. The bottom bun was not toasted at all and it had a HUGE amount of mayo. The patty was alright, but wasn't nearly as good as the black bean burger I  had at Knott's. Overall, I'd give it a 2.5/5 My boyfriend ordered the Original Cheeseburger. He had the same issue with the bun and said he'd much rather had just gotten a Big Mac..yeah They're fries were good though (: lol Crispy, yet fluffy, not like the floppy McDonald's kind (sorry McDonald's )

I bought my (pregnant) sister and her 2 year old daughter here today for lunch and there was glass in her water. I wont be coming here again.  the food was ok, i guess. the atmosphere was fine, ok? THERE WAS GLASS IN HER WATER.

This place was already one of the last choices as all of South Street had hour long waits. Another bad omen was that 4 tables were not clear of dishes/trash as we walk to the bar. The bar was about 3/4 full of patrons and recently remodeled. I guess they got some tablets now.. Not sure if they are meant to replace the menu or the waiters. Looks like nothing can be ordered from them but you can play some bootleg games for 1.99. My girlfriend and I waited there with our server light blinking on the tablet for at least 10 minutes. As we were starting to get up we were offered menus but by then it was too late. We just wanted some quick happy hour drinks and appetizers especially since it was gonna end in 30 minutes.
We always come here for the happy hours. Met server Donny J. the second time, fantastic guy with great customer service. Keep up the good work. Merry (no snow) Christmas buddy!

I come here pretty often and typically I have good service. I came today and Sam served us. Never seen her bartend before so I'm not sure if they just trained her to be in the bar or if she's just new in general but she gave such bad service. I'm not sure if she judged my friend and I because we are young girls but she was rude from the start. She asked for my ID, gave her my CA ID and she just stared at me instead of saying "hey can I have one that's not expired". When I finally look up at her she's like "I need one that's not expired." With attitude so I have her my license and she took About 10 minutes to finally give us our drinks. When she did she took about about 12 to come and ask if we were ready to order. We ordered, got our food and we got refills on our drinks. She took about 30 minutes to acknowledge us! She was too busy being best friends with some guy who sat close to us at the bar too. She was standing in front of us the WHOLE time yip yapping away and not ONCE did she turn to ask how we were doing! After she finally realized we were there, she asked if we were okay. She got busy and I get it, I'm a server myself and it can be overwhelming but if you can't handle then ask for help. Took her about her 10 to ask if we needed anything and we wanted our check, brought it to us and waited about 15 for her to cash out. The food was great but the service was awful.

This experience was a disaster from the time we walked in..  Hostess: dazed and confundes, couldn't answer a simple question Waitress: Gigi was kind, helpful and friendly Food: disgusting, mahi mahi was just the worst anyone can ever have, it was as dry and hard as if it were a piece of cardboard. How does a chef get fish so dry, by over cooking it obviously. Same was with the sizzling-shrimp, disgusting.. Hard shrimp, not good at all, not tasty at all. Chef needs to be told clearly, we are paying customers, we do deserve better food than what we got served.

Came here on a Tuesday night with my husband, brother and mother. First there was a 30 minute wait for a table. That didnt bother us. we waited. Once seated, our server came to take our drinks orders, thats when problems began.  My brother who is in his 30's was asked for ID before he could order beer. He didnt have anything on him at the time so settled for soda. But it continues. My mother who is in her 50's was also asked to show her ID to which the server had to inspect her date of birth in great detail. This was truly baffling yet it does not end there =/  When she wanted to order a bottle of wine she was told she can only order it if she was to share it with another person ....we do like to enjoy ourselves and have a good meal but when you limit you're alcohol like this how do you expect to make sales? I wonder if we had got to ordering food would they limit that? Would they give us fries with our burger or do we have to share it? Either way we left the restaurant without continuing and found a Sizzler who had no problems giving us what we wanted. Would not set foot in TGI Cerritos if i was paid.
donnie was awesome and funny.  he made my experience more fun.  the food is always great.

Well my boyfriend likes it more than me and they do have a variety of food to select from but okay.  Anything Jack Daniels is good with me.  I had the Jack Daniels Sampler plate which was like $5.99, so I scored there.  It was a combo of Baby Back Ribs, Shrimp and Chicken Nuggets and all of it was really great, very tasty and plentiful.  Needed some mash potatoes or veggies on the side but I was completely satisfied.  Will gets the same thing, Jack Daniels Shrimp and Chicken Combo with Mashed Potatoes and Broccoli.. Can you say "creature of habit"?  He's a happy camper. Two thumbs up.
Came here yesterday with my boyfriend for an early dinner and the food tasted great. Our server Jessica I. was wonderful and polite.
Great atmosphere, good food and terrific service. Love the hot wings. Rakeen was our server. He was friendly, but not overreaching and super attentive. We will be back!

Literally worst worst WORST!!!  Service ever. Me and sister arrived around 6:30 pm and I knew exactly what I wanted. I order the endless appetizers and she order a Friday's trio. Now my first appetizer took about 10 minutes no big deal and I put in my order for my next. About 15 minutes later my sisters plate came out and her wings were cold like they were sitting and my food had not come out. We let the server know and she said ok I'll get you some fresh ones. I then put in another appetizer order since it was clearly taking a while. About another 30 minutes pass and no food has come out and we brought it to the attention of the server twice and finally my sister wings appear and still nothing for me. And to top it off the wings were cold again. We got the manager and let him know the situation and he comped most of our bill. So we only paid $6 for the eaten pot stickers. Literally worst service and worst run TGIF I've been to. Frankly I wish I could give zero stars. After looking at the other reviews on here I wish I would've looked before we decided to sit here for an hour waiting for food.

The whole experience was terrible. First when it was time to be seated to our table there was only three chairs and we were a party of 4. Second issue was when we received are food we had no silverware. Third issue/problem I asked for my meat medium rare. I get blue rare. If you notice the majority of the TGI Fridays have a two star rating. That was the clue in not trying this place but when you have kids and they want to try the endless app you pretty much give in.

I ordered a Normal meal and my husband ordered the endless apps. All he wanted was the wings and mozzarella cheese sticks and the ran out very fast. I would like to know why on Earth would the waitress take our order knowing they're running low. My husband was very disappointed. Poor management, especially on a Sunday when u know it's going to be busy.

You can tell our server Rakeen was a new waiter but he was very friendly and polite. He assisted us with all of our needs and and if he forgot something he was very apologetic which I liked. Overall I was happy with the service

This place has the best food and my server, Oscar, made the experience that much more awesome. Helped us choose exactly what was right for us and told us about some of the new items on the menu too! Typically, you go to a restaurant and midway throughout your meal your server is no where to be found. Not Oscar! He made sure that we felt right at home and was very personable. Has a sense of humor and made us laugh  I will for sure be back! Keep it up Fridays!

I came on a busy Sunday got to sit in the bar area and was helped out quickly. Better than other fridays and happy hour couldn't have been better. The margaritas are super good and had the Mark WEst Pinot Noir.  Awesome wine
Our server was real cool and hooked us up with all the deals and specials.

Came in to celebrate a family birthday. We had a good dinner though the service was slow for a Wednesday night.  Jack Daniel's sandwich and burgers can't be beat. They are awesomely delicious.  And of course they sang a Happy Birthday to the birthday boy. Thank you for the memories

Looks nicer than before but this is still the worst TGI Fridays I've been to.  They got my order wrong, the bottom of the patty in my wife's burger was burnt, and my prime rib dip sandwich was really weak and pathetic.  Their staff needs to be retrained or something.  Definitely a 2 star restaurant.  It's not the worst place I've been to.

I don't come out often, but when I did tonight,  I made a mistake coming here. Service is slow and slow and did I mention slow. Happy hour must equal don't allow customers to order hour. I think this place is understaffed, but from the no hustle, lack of attention top ours and other tables, I'd say the service is just bad. Last time I come here. Won't be recommending anyone here.

So we came here for a paint night event. Get parking right away no problem. Walked in and they seated us in the bar why who knows there were plenty of tables open. I finally after 20 mins went back to the server to ask if there was a waiter for that area we haven't even gotten water no one came to the table! The host that sat us looked at me like she had never seen me in my life and asked your sitting over in the bar...with a glazed over look in her eyes.....ummmmmmmmm yeah can you just get someone. My friend also asked to be directed to the bathroom and she just pointed to a general area and walked away. Geez....won't ever be coming back to this locations again

I don't normally come to TGI but when I do, I always request to be served by my favorite waitress Cassidy, she always brings good energy and always recommending me great things to try! She's the reason my boyfriend and I come back!
This restaurant is so unorganized.  The host keep telling us that they were getting a table ready for us and fifteen and it's still not ready.  They are slow.  Service is really bad.

The plan was to sit down for 30 minutes to wait for our movie time.  We order drinks, waiter gives my drink to someone else.  We order the bottomless wings, potato skins and flat bread.  we figure, snack and drink.  We figure its a good plan for a party of 4.  It was pain. staking and difficult for waiter to bring out any more than one plate of each.  After waiter told us that he could not bring us a second serving because there were cameras and hos manager was watching..  made us feel like we were steeling food.  Bill came at $60 for our 30min sit down.  We left with a bad taste of this place.  Never order their bottomless scam.

So we came for dinner here expecting some good food but unfortunately we had to wait just to be seated. I count 10 tables that are empty and the host is saying 35 to 45 minutes wait. This is ridiculous.
It's exactly what you would expect from a chain restaurant. We come here a lot because the kids like the Ipad on the table. Food is consistent and service is good.

I went in for in lunch to celebrate one of my co-worker's birthday. We have an hour lunch and we all made our orders right on the spot when they seated us. We waited an hour and we never got served our food. We had to leave and get back to work without even receiving our food. It's Friday, you ain't got no job and you don't have sh*t to do! Oh wait, it was Wednesday and I was on my lunch break...oh well... This location is in the beautiful city of Cerritos in the huge shopping center off of Town Center by Wal-Mart. Location is great, the patio is nicely shaded by beautiful tress and the inside is pretty big.  We caught a late lunch and I have to say for close to 2PM it was pretty poppin' for a weekday. That being said we didn't have to wait which was nice. The service was top notch, not too much not ignored, ya' know what I mean. Couldn't pass it up. All in all it was a really good lunch. They have a large menu with something for everyone including dieters, Vegheads and kids. Very clean and the refills came without asking.  Thank you TGI Friday's I will have to stop in one day for happy hour.

The waitress was nice don't get me wrong but she hardly checked up on me I was the one always having to flag her down for something and it was just slow service and I did not understand why when there wasn't really any customers during that time. The second time I went which was today 4/8/15 I figured since I was running late I decided to order my food in advance so that when I got there it would be ready and I could just eat. Tell me why when I get there I state to the gentleman who took my order that I was the person who phoned in and he stated oh yes let me go put that order in for you and I am thinking in head really bro that is why I phoned in advance so that I wouldn't have to wait long then he leaves to place my order and no one wants to seat me servers are walking by hearing me jingle my keys and I finally decided to seat myself down at the bar when I had told the waitress that I placed in a phone order and was upset that no one could sit me down she didn't even want to hear me out and went straight to the manager. Then when the other gentleman came back with my bill I noticed my bill was higher than usually when I looked at the menu I noticed he had placed in the wrong order and from there I just told the manager everything that happened she was sorry and got everything corrected right away.  The only thing that sucks is that it took almost the rest of my lunch to get my food. I had to eat really fast and couldn't really enjoy my lunch day. When asking for my bill I guess the manager felt really bad for all the inconveniences she gave me a free meal, but my thing is this place is the closet to me for a decent lunch I didn't care if I had to pay all I ask is to get my order right and have it ready when I call and get there so that way I can enjoy my lunch especially if its a slow lunch time and there really isn't any customers there should be no reason for screw ups. If we can just get the customer service corrected then I can consider giving this place a higher rating and the management should consider reading these because it seems I am not the only one upset about the customer services.

Hot day cold beer.  Checked in with my wing Diablo aka Cameron aka RainMan.  We sat at the bar.  The cool red haired bartender was working.  All was good until a 50 something huge Mannish looking Female Troll sat next to DCR.  She ordered nachos and a large "Margo".  The food arrived. Girlfriend then started chowing down on the nachos as if she had not had any food for a week.   All the while, she was eyeing DCR  as if he was next on the menu.  Yikes.  I don't know, he may have liked it.  Anyhow, I'm like Ghandi, (in fact, my mantra is "be the change that you want in the world") a very sentient individual so I thought "whatev".   Next, the mass murderer looking psycho from a few weeks ago walks in and sits next to the troll chic.  He is a psycho looking hillbilly mullet dude with a tatt of the Marlboro Man his right shoulder.  WTF? Even Ghandi would be creeped out.   I told DCR to order a steak that way we would have utensils to use as weapons in the event that we were attacked. By either of the above subjects. Whew. After one hour they both left.  I'm still creeped out.  The beers kept getting colder and easier to drink.  Again, this location has the coldest draught beer in the area.

This location is the worst location I have ever been too! I recently called in a to go order for Jack Daniels Ribs and shrimp. I asked the person taking the order if I could have extra JD sauce on the side and she told me it was an extra .79 cents for the sauce. This is the most ridiculous thing I had heard especially since I was just there a few days prior and was not charged. I spoke to the Manager Megan who was very unfriendly and said they have been charging extra for the sauce for years. I don't about anyone else but this is the first I have heard of them charging extra money for their JD sauce. What's next, extra for ranch or napkins.....
Slowest crappiest service I've even seen in my life. It's like no one cares about their job here. The food is decent but they really gotta develop their staff.

We were here seated at a booth and saw a cockroach just running across the wall. It was the most disgusting thing I've ever seen. If there's one then there's a lot  more crawling around. Manager was nice enough to comp us but I will not be returning to this place.

Not impressed. The service was just okay. The food was lousy. My Jack Daniel's chicken was way overcooked. It's as if someone just took it out of the freezer, threw it in the microwave, and tossed it on the grill for char marks. My daughter was disappointed by the size of the kids pasta. It was really bland as well. My son didn't like his pizza and we tossed it. He ate his fries and that was about it. My husband didn't care too much for his burger. We hadn't been in years and probably won't be back.

Came here to enjoy some beer and some very bad for you type food. Got what we wanted, the only problem was that our crab cake was mostly just bread with a mild hint of crab flavored seasoning. We ate it because we were starved from the day and didn't say anything to our waitress because we didn't want to cause a fuss. We knew that TGIF is a huge chain and don't want to bother management over something they don't control (recipes). Just trying to spread the word not to order those crab cakes!

This place is just terrible lol you know it's bad when they mess up your drinks. Long story short I ordered some nachos the chips were burnt and the taste was horrible. I reorder the same thing and they literally took the toppings from the first order and microwaved the toppings on new chips. The only thing they got right was the ice water with lemon

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: For a Thursday night, we got 1 beer an hour. The service was pretty slow, and by the time we got out food, we realized how mediocrely tasting they are.

Don't every come to Friday's on a Friday this place is horrible. It's been an hour and still no food . This place needs to get there crap together. I will never come back !!!! If you're not hungry and you don't have shit to do come here !!!! Never never never  Now I'm looking at the other reviews and they are just about the same . Worst service ever .

Loved it here. I went on a Sunday and it wasn't packed. Our server was so nice and he would check up on my friends and I to make sure we were doing okay, I forgot his name though. Others Friday's I've been to are always packed on Sundays but this location was the best, no waiting :) I would definitely go back.

Usually, the food and service is good. Today was atrocious. Food swimming in oil, hard cold bacon in the burger, soggy burger meat, and cold french fries,  We were given no side plates, silverware, or napkins. Very disappointed.
first time here last night, the food was great i had the sizzling chicken and shrimp. Our server Donnie was legit. He's got a really outgoing and charismatic personality.

Just for clarification, this event happened last year but I forgot that I had rated this place so highly at one point in time.  My boyfriend's cousin came to town from Mexico and she is 25. She's a pretty young college aged girl like you and me except she's from Mexico. Well, we ordered a round of drinks and the waiter checks for her I.D.; fair enough. She gives her passport to the waiter who sees that it's from Mexico and then swiftly declines her order for alcohol based on what? That they don't take passports as a form of I.D.  Let me just make a few things clear here:  1) Many tourists eat at this restaurant because there is a reputable Sheraton across the street as well as the fact that it's in a reputable plaza like the Cerritos Towne Center. I have been in TGI Fridays enough at this location (I used to go once a week) to see people from Australia, England, and other general places from Europe get carded only to see them serve a passport as I.D. and the waiters all see this as permissible.  2) There is a sign in the front of the establishment which states that they take passports as a form of I.D.  So there's something going on here. Either the manager at the time was racist or just had a completely different standard for where the passports come from...which means he's racist. I don't even know how else to explain it.  Then, when we called the manager over and pointed this out, he laughed at us and said it was okay just this once as if we were burdening him.  Then, as the night drew on, the waiter was increasingly more rude, not very adamant about serving us anymore and he messed up our order. That was the night we decided not to come back.  Let me tell you though that we were building up to that point. As management changed, so did the waiters and some of the male waiters there have made it very clear that they are not comfortable with serving a same sex couple (remember I said boyfriend at the beginning of this review?) and several of my friends have complained and not wanted to come back because certain waiters have always been colder to us than others and steadily avoided serving our table for very long. I don't really want to write a novel here, but that's basically it. We won't go back because we don't feel welcome and it seems that the management at the time (I don't know if he's still around) was very narrow minded and openly discriminated against certain people.  A disclaimer: The manager did attempt to contact me after I contacted corporate and he left a short message. I tried to get back to him once and he wasn't there (obviously he can't be there 24/7) so I just let it go. There's no point in talking to that man when we've had these problems before and don't intend on going back to hold his hand and resolve them.

Can i do 1/4 of a star? Just because I actually like their food? Their jack daniels menu is awesome... half off appetizers all day on Sunday is great.. but.... OMG!! This location is better off being a Fast Food restaurant!! Customer service is completely non-existant! Never coming back! It's a joke. Me and my family waited for 20 minutes for an open table, even though there were 4 open tables.. we waited 10 minutes for the hostess to come out of the back of the restaurant. Then another 10 minutes for them to figure out their life, before we got sat to a table that was open the whole time we were waiting!! A busser came to us and attempted to seat us, but when we said that we were being helped by the hostess, he said "well that's just how it is.." then gave my wife an ugly look and stood there for 2 minutes looking irritated like we spoke French to him or asked for his kidney.. I get that this may be your part time job, but if you don't like it.. QUIT! Then we waited another 15 minutes and finally a server came to  take our drink order. And the only reason someone came was because my wife had to stand up and raise her hand! We were there to celebrate my son's bday.. so if it wasn't for him we would have left! By the time we got our food we were already there for an hour and 15 mins. We got there at 8:45pm. We got our food around 10:30pm.. the dining area was almost empty but the bar area was maybe half full.. I saw at least 6 servers and almost everyone had their food already. 2 of the servers were busy chatting up a couple of girls while the other servers were nowhere to be found. We got our food and ate in like 15 minutes. Then asked for the check and to go boxes. They had dropped off the check and took another 15 minutes to even see the server come out of the back. But by then I had had enough and was walking with the check and my credit card to find anybody I can to give it to so I can pay. Staff were walking right past me like I didn't exist! Finally my server came running from the back with one box and a bag. "I told her nevermind I don't need a to go box and I just wanted to pay and leave." So we did and left, and will never be back again! I have worked in customer service since I was 15 years old. First at McDonalds, then at a hotel and now as a nurse! Never have I ran into such disregard for customer service and hospitality. As a customer I felt unwelcomed, under appreciated and I have never been treated so low like me and my family were a Burden to them. WORST SERVICE EVER!

Havent been here for awhile for a reason.  The clam chowder compares to kenos or the nursing home menus. The spinach dip looks unappetizing and tastes as if it has been sitting for hours under a heat lamp. Not for awhile again.  A long while.

I went here with my friend recently.  But, prior to that I haven't been to a TGIFs in years!   The service was so great that it warranted a positive review. ** Excellent customer service our server came by VERY often.  And, I do mean VERY often.   I was trying to check ingredients and calorie count and she was nice enough to really check on it and get all the info I was looking for. If I was a happy hour every Friday night kinda girl, this would be my go to local spot.  I'm not. But... if I have another chance to meet my friends for a spur of the moment happy hour jaunt, I won't hesitate to come back here.

I don't know what happened to this place, or the whole TGIF franchise. The service is slow, food sucks, drinks are overpriced, and the whole experience has gone downhill. I used to love TGIF but it seems as though they're lacking in quality nowadays. The 2 for $20 now excludes dessert; even the selections from the appetizers and entrees have shrunken. I came here twice in the last month and both times I was disappointed. An order of chicken fingers is one of the worst entrees ever- stale fries and chicken that looks blah on the plate. Yeah, no thanks TGIF.

I cannot rate the food since I didn't have any but the bar section is pretty cool.  Unfortunately we came when HH was not available but regardless our tab wasn't too bad. The beer was nice and cold, the bar tenders were attentive (since the place was pretty empty for a Saturday night) and they had some games on the TV. If I'm in the area, I'll definitely swing by again.

Came here today on a Saturday at 5:45. While waiting to be be seated, I observed 6 employees (including a manager) standing around the hostess area while only two servers were scrambling to keep. At one point there was a line of 4 groups waiting to put there name down for atleast 4-5 minutes all while the group of employees stood around and chatted and finally had to interrupt the gossiping and received a cold attitude.  Also,  the fact that the manager walked around with an arrogant attitude barking out orders without even caring about his surroundings or doing the unthinkable of perhaps helping his team, all while having ATLEAST 7-10 empty tables. This is clearly a very mismanaged restaurant. I sympathize with the servers and commend them for having a great attitude.

Came here on Friday for late night happy hour since there are specials at 10pm until closing. PRETZELS WITH CRAFT BEER CHEESE: - Thick, warm pretzels served with our creamy craft beer-cheese dipping sauce made with regionally crafted beer, garnished with crispy bacon and green onions. - slightly crispy on the inside and super soft on the inside - probably the best appetizer - I didn't actually try the cheese part but the actual pretzel was money BBQ CHICKEN FLATBREAD: - Crispy flatbread topped with tender pulled chicken breast in a chipotle barbecue sauce and baked with Monterey Jack cheese, cheddar, cilantro and hand-cut red peppers and red onion. - very disappointing - the flatbread was so tough that I think it had been sitting out for a while - would NOT recommend We also got the POTATO SKINS and the MOZZARELLA STICKS. SERVICE: Happy Hour is only available in the bar area but we had a party of 8. So fortunately the service people noticed we were disappointed and offered to have us sit at the main dining room but get Happy Hour prices. Our waitress was very kind and checked up on us quite often. In the end if you have a large party they automatically charge gratuity.  ENVIRONMENT: can be quite loud depending on the crowd. The tables have the trademark white and red stripes. There is also an outside patio area that is part of the bar. The outside patio area is prime for 2nd hand smoking.  Overall, decent place for late night drinks and to hang out. The food is pretty horrible but it's all about the drinks anyway. The prices are reasonable at happy hour. Though only some things are discounted. If you're looking for somewhere that's open late though on Friday this is your place!

This place is pretty poppin' on a Friday night, but then again it is called TGI Fridays. Anyways, my dad and I ordered the 2 for $20 (drinks not included). It's a pretty good because you do get a sufficient amount of food. You can always get more premium stuff such as steak or seafood for a surcharge of 3 or 5 dollars, but we stuck with the basic 10/10. So overall, the quality is decent. It doesn't have the home cooked fresh taste so don't come here if you're looking for that. If you are looking for a good vibed place and bar food, then this is the place. I got the "Friday's Shrimp" with a side of Macaroni and Cheese. It originally came with fries but you can swap it out. The best part about this entree was the Mac and Cheese, maybe because I love Mac and Cheese. The shrimp was better than I expected! It was crispy and the batter had flavor! Enough about my meal though. My dad got the "Balsamic Chicken Caesar Salad". It's everything that the name says. Just balsamic, chicken, and Caesar. My dad found it mediocre at best. It was just a bowl of Caesar with some chicken. The chicken had a drizzle of balsamic and was a bit dry. Before our entrees we got the friend green beans, they're pretty crispy and when you dunk it in ranch, even better. The sauce that comes with these little beans is a mix between a horseradish kick and ranch. Service is a bit slow, but that's what expected when the restraint is packed and on a Friday. The atmosphere is nice though. It can be a family type place (away from the bar) or a good hangout spot with friends. We will be coming again because they also have an all you can eat appetizers on certain appetizers.
Terrible customer service. Took 27 minutes just to get are sodas. Food was slow waitress was unfriendly worth the drive to the Long Beach Towne Center one

I had lunch here today. It was the first time I'd been here in over six months. I was amazed at the service. It used to be TERRIBLE but today our server was exceptional, refilling ice teas and checking back often. Even the manager came by to check on things. When a waiter who wasn't even our server stopped to check on us I started to think "okay, this is almost ridiculous!".  The food, as always, is darn good but not exceptional. I had the Jack Daniels BBQ burger (a great choice if you are in the mood for a burger) and Oreo Madness for dessert. Oreo Madness are two giant oreo cookies with cookies & cream ice cream filling on a plate of drizzled caramel & chocolate. Yum!

Our server was friendly, but obviously overwhelmed with the number of tables she had. They need more servers. Kareoke Wednesdays are obnoxiously loud and aweful!  The food was not appetizing. The appetizers tasted like they came from their freezer selections at the grocery store. The burger I had was tasty, but the bun fell apart soon after, and the lettuce and tomato were wilted and gummy from the heat of the burger. I'd  never had that happen before.  I will not be returning to TGIF. For the prices they charge, and the crappy food they serve, I'd rather go to In-N-Out for some quality fresh food.

I haven't been here in 10 years, yet I've lived in Cerritos for over 30 years.  Yeah, I've got, shall I say, not so fond memories of this place, but that's not to TGI Friday's fault, but more so of the fact that...well...you're only young and stupid, hopefully only once.  Right? I came here with a group of coworkers.  I must say, after reading horrible reviews from other Yelpers, I was a bit petrified of coming here.  Right off the back: -Service:  I heard our server say to some members of my party that the service may not be great in bigger parties...and to be honest, after the fact, that couldn't be any further from the truth.  I had zero problems with our server's attentiveness. -Food:  I'll say this, the food here is GOOD, at best.  I got the Jack Daniels burger, which I thought was...pretty good, but at the same time, very small.  The fries were good. -Drink:  Beer selection was decent.  Back in the day when I came here, it was two LITs for me.  I wasn't about to do that, again...besides, I can't stand those things, anymore. Will I come here again?  Yeah, when it's convenient and with I'm with a group, but I've got a place for that already in HB. Oh, and the bathroom is wheelchair accessible, but I've known that for years, anyway.

TGI need to step it up. Most of the food here taste too bland or too salty. I had a rib eye steak and it was dry. The fries they added way too much salt. The salad on the side taste like its been out of refrigeration and already premade with the sauce. However the baby back rib tasted alright. I'm giving this a 3 stars because TGI still has potential. They need to focus more on the plates they serve and less on getting employees to do good service. Customers prioritize excellent food over excellent service. I'll be back soon.

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: I come here with my cousin every year for Christmas. We sneak away from the house and the parents to get our drink on! They have good fruity drinks and a variety of beers. They also have good happy hour prices and the snacks are tasty too although when we come for xmas we dont eat because we probably stuffed our face with our family dinner. The people who work here are nice and normally we sit outside and don't have a problem finding a spot. The waitresses come and check in on us and all is good. We'll be stopping in in exactly a week from today!!

The service here was tremendously horrible. Came in with an appetite and left with an unhappy stomach but it took half an hour for over cooked potato skins , soggy mozzarella sticks, under cooked steak.

Stopped coming here when they got rid of decent tequila in favor of trendy flavored vodka. Turns out they corrected the error and now feature some very decent top shelf selections.  Happy hour was always a deal, but the "training store" status made this location a revolving door of good, bad and worthless servers and manager trainees. Luckily a few great long term folks are still around (Veronica).  Four out of five stars because its an inconsistent chain and still has the absolute worst, uncomfortable and poorly maintained patio furniture of any restaurant around.

ridiculous wait times, had 5 servers standing up at the front for at least 15 minutes talking and laughing away when they should have been cleaning tables or doing something to look busy. ordered spinach dip which looked like it had been sitting there too long. Old chips were given to go with the old ass dip. horrible service. waited another half hour for the bill. wont come back here
Poor service, as I tried to order my appetizers the waiter dared to tell me that I couldn't share with my family my wings really? Worst experience I've had at a TGIF.
Been coming here for years.  Great place to hang out and watch football at the bar.  Sammy P is the friendliest bartender and gives the place a good energy

Anthony was the best server. The food was okai. The drinks were pretty good. Georgia peach tasted like juice. Definitely want to come back since I live 5 minutes away just because Anthony was that awesome. I'll try the "blue captain" next time. Blue moon with a shot of captain Morgan

$10 endless appetizers. They took literally 25+ min to bring out all out stuff. Be sure to order your second rounds when you receive the food because the chances are you'll be waiting 20+ min. SUPER SLOW bringing out the food. Staff was super friendly, but I do have to say that it was pretty annoying being at the restaurant for 2 hours and only getting 2 plates. This location really needs to get it together. I've been to the South Gate location and it was so much better!
Best place to eat super friendly staff management is always on top of everything I am glad they make the servers clean with bleach

It was not too bad to eat here during lunch time. I had about 40 minutes altogether and the food came and I had time to eat it all and still chat with friends. The service was pretty good, our waitress was nice and she checked on our table quite a few times! I had ordered the Parmesan-Crusted Chicken and it was delicious! It came with a salad that had slices of cherry/grape tomatoes and what I want to say is mozzarella cheese chunks, that was pretty good although I could go in a different direction with the dressing, it wasn't bad just not agreeable with me. The spinach bread appetizer was pretty good too! I would recommend that be tried at least once! All in all it was a good lunch break for me! Fast and Great!

So so sad, but the reviews are so so true. I didn't even WANT to give this place 1 star!!! But of course, I had to. I came here with my mom and sister for a girls night. First, the waiter who was serving us forgot my mother's drink, and we had to stop another waitress for the drink. She also exclaimed to us that our food was ready and she didn't know why it wasn't to us. THEN the waiter who totally forgot about us came out AFTER our food was served to us and he said that HE brought out our food when he didn't, only to realize our food was frozen. My mother also said NO BROCCOLI, because she's allergic to broccoli, and he plate was covered in it. We had to totally leave the place without even touching the food. While I was walking out I overheard the so called "manager" say, "And they didn't even pay for it?!" Trust me, do not waste your time here.

I personally dont like TGIF but... I got a gift card for christmas so I came in. It was HECTIC in there. Super busy. We got the waitress LOREEN. Who wasnt even assigned to us but im glad she was. She was absolutely AMAZING. SUNNY also helped her. He was AMAZING too. Loreen apologized to us before hand about the wait and the future wait cause it was busy. I loved that she did that. She filled our drinks when they needed to be, and our food took a while but her and Sunny's service made it worth the wait. Sunny stepped in for a second for her and he was very sweet and also apologized about the wait. Our food was delicious!! I can honestly say, that those two have definitely changed my mind about TGIF. I WILL be comming back thanks to them. Before, my food was never good and service was horrible, but that was the one by Knotts berry farm. They handled everything so well with it being as busy as it was. They did a great job!! Thank you again Loreen and Sunny for such a great experience tonight!!!

Horrible service!!! Every time I come here service does not change. My colleagues and I come here because it's a half way point for us to meet up and enjoy our time after work and lunch time. Ordered appetizers and drinks my friends got theirs I had to walk up to the bar to get mine because the waitress took too long to bring it. I was offered a beer that they no longer served and chose another but still to no avail my friends were 1/2 way done by the time I had to go to the bar. We had to ask to place a dinner order at that time we ordered another round I again had to go to the bar and get our drinks because of the lack of customer service in this place is ridiculous. I then had to bus my own table in order to make room for our food. Just ridiculous. Never had such lack of concern for your customer. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE BASED ON CUSTOMER SATISFACTION. they must have forgot that the customers are why they are here, without them you will not be in business. The way the manager handled the situation was unsatisfactory, excusing the behaviors of the so called waitress. She may need to go to some kind of training on customer satisfaction. Manager name is Dani Meza and if you get a server named Iztel run or ask for a different server. You will regret it if you don't. Server Carlos took over and did a great job after the fact.

I used to work down the street from this Friday's and used to receive awesome service. I was with a family of ten and when we arrived we were excited to see how many empty tables there were for 7 pm on a Saturday night. But we were quite surprised to find out the wait would be one hour. During our wait, I noticed several servers just standing around and maybe about six parties were served before us. After asking the host how much longer our wait would be they informed us they were waiting on a particular party to finish with their table so we could be seated and they stated they couldn't seat us elsewhere due to the amount of servers on this shift. I understand if they are short staffed and everyone in my party continued to give this Friday's the benefit of the doubt since we've previously received great service at this location. I ordered the endless appetizers & my loaded potato skins came out disgustingly crispy and dry. Our server Nicholes was sweet and seemed like he was doing the best he could so I'm not complaining about him at all (especially because he seemed new & I know very well it can take a while to get the hang of a new job). But, we were there for over three hours, maybe for about 40 minutes that the people in my party were actually consuming food. It was honestly just a tasteless, tedious and long dining experience and I was far from satisfied with my food. And please keep in mind that I began writing this review about 10:20 pm the second I paid for my meal.

I have to start this off on a positive note, some of the sesame Jack chicken strips were edible and the green bean fries satisfied my craving. Now for the rest of the review... If I could give this place 0 stars, I would. My boyfriend and I ordered to go, like we've done millions of times over the past 6 years, but this time was just an absolute waste of time, money, and energy.    I ordered: Friday's three for all: sesame Jack chicken strips, loaded potato skins and the green bean fries. Boyfriend ordered a BBQ pulled pork sandwich and that's when she began to repeat my order....I mentioned the sandwich comes with a side and she said "oh yea...." So I just blurted out veggies to make it simple cause I could tell the three for all was still processing.  Pick up time is in 20 minutes, cool. The boyfriend leaves and a few minutes later he calls me. They told him they called me 3 times to tell me that they can't do the three for all with the options I chose, so I would have to order them all separately. I said "WWHHAAT?! We order the same thing EVERYTIME!!! And NO ONE called me!! Not once!" He told her that but she insisted that she couldn't do it so I said FINE order the TWO for all then!  2 minutes later I get another phone call "Ok, I guess they CAN do it, they're gonna make your 3 for all now."        So, he's waiting there and 10 minutes later I get a text "Just got the food, they forgot to give us our sauces. They're getting them now." Got the food home, the sauce they put in the box was ONE ranch and ONE wasabi ranch.....no Jack daniel's sauce for the chicken, no sour cream for the potato skins, no BBQ sauce for the sandwich. Which wouldn't be so bad if the potato skins weren't over salted, the pulled pork wasn't already lacking BBQ sauce, and the chicken wasn't mostly dry chicken jerky. Needless to say, I have had better food for way cheaper.    Oh, and they had the nerve to turn down our $5 off coupon even after the whole fiasco of making him wait for the 3 for all (and lying about calling me...tsk tsk). No good TGI, it's no wonder you guys are going downhill fast. Step it up in your kitchen. And hire some customer friendly hostesses. You guys are thieves, taking people's hard earned money to profit off of food which doesn't require any preparation more complicated than the "deep fry" instructions on the side of the bag. Next time I want TGI Fridays, I'll make it my damn self.

Have never had a good experience at this restaurant.  Experience 1: Ordered a steak and beer. As the steak is being brought out by one of the servers, she clearly has no idea what table it was supposed to, so I'm staring at her and motioning to her that it's mine. We make eye contact and she ignores me as I'm saying "I think that's mine" and places it at the next table in front of me in front of some old guy. Only as he has cut into it and about to eat a piece does she realize her mistake. She grabs whats left and puts it in front of me. Can you believe that...? They didn't even offer to discount the meal. Experience 2: Took my dad out for Father's day. He picked this place. Why? No f-ing clue. It took 2 HOURS to get the food. Food arrived under cooked in some parts, missing things, etc. No discount on the crap service/food. Manager gave me a "$10 coupon" for "next time." There will be no next time.

I seriously considered giving this place one star but since I keep coming back I have to give it 2. To be a serious 1 star contender I would have to vow to never come back to a place.  I've been coming here sporadically for years. My friend lives around the corner and this is a convenient place to meet for happy hour drinks. Over all those years I have experienced some of the worst service imaginable such as orders that never get brought to your table, wrong drinks delivered to table, issues with the bill, waiters and waitresses that vanish, etc.. you get the picture. If you come here expect all of the above.  I wont eat the food here because it is horrible. Its not the location, its TGIF in general. They have horrible food. And now that they have to show the calorie count of dishes it really makes you think about what your ordering.  You know what to expect at TGIF and this location delivers the TGIF experience wholeheartedly.
Great happy hour deals!  Food is mediocre. It's good place to just come with a group or bunch of friends.

Cerritos is such a quiet city and I enjoyed this Fridays. We were sat down immediately on a Sunday afternoon and everyone was very attentive to our wants and needs. I spilled my drink which I hadn't had a chance to drink yet and the waiter took it upon himself to ask the manager if I could have another drink, which was so appreciated!! As usual the food was yummy!

We almost decided not to go because of all the negative reviews, but I am so glad we didn't! The service was amazing! The food was so delicious it was incredible! Do not listen to the bad reviews! Our server was friendly and attentive. The food was incredible!!!

Thank you Ashley, my server tonight, for providing the WORST service I ever had. Best  thing you did tonight? Greeted us within 2 minutes of sit down. The bad? Oh it goes on and on. 10 minutes to bring out drinks. Over 30 minutes to take our entree ORDER, that's right, OUR ORDER. Even after trying to wave you down 5 times. No plates given with our appetizer, we had to eat off the main plate. No table check, no drink refills. After you finally took our order and the entree came (within a reasonable amount of time) I was fine cause I finally had my food, my beer and my date. You would've still had a decent tip coming your way but you over-charged me on FOUR ITEMS!? I asked you to fix it and you only fix one out of the four? Like I said on the receipt, if you wan't your tip, you can fix the items and claim the rest. It works out to over 25%, which is more than you would've ever had coming but I was fed up and had to get out of there By the way, I've worked in the restaurant industry for most of my life. If I ever go back, I'll be especially clear I do not want you or even be put near your section. Everyone else seems to be doing it right, especially your heart of the house since the food was prepared well and brought out on the time. Its was you that single handed ruined the night.

I gave TGIF a second chance; sadly they'll most likely not get a third. I had a stunningly incompetent service at their location in the LB Town Center (see prior review) and was comped with an $8 (yes, you read that correctly) gift certificate.  Second most convenient location was Cerritos, so it's my off day 4pm lunch. Hostess, wearing those patterned black nylons (not the "I'm a stripper" fishnets or "I'm"m classy" plain black) seated me in the second small table to the left of the hostess podium.  Server arrived (Julianna) took my drink order (iced tea).  While I was waiting, I counted six tables that hadn't been bussed; understandable if its the lunch or dinner rush, but it took the staff (which appeared to be more than adequate for mid-day) 20 minutes to clear tables.  The last one, the booth on my left, got cleared just before I received my bill. I think my server got assigned to another section, as the hostess gal came back to take my order (the Salmon Langostino).  Salmon was fine; cooked properly.  The lobster pieces (all six of them) were disappointing.  Unlike most menus you've seen at other restaurants, what you see here is definitely what you get.  Veggies were either over- or undercooked; carrots were crunchy, while the broccoli was barely holding together.  I also opted for those Parmesan fries, which the hostess told me "there's an up charge for those".  While I saw calorie count info for the sides, I honestly didn't see such an up charge on the menu.  You also get a whole six (that's 6) wedges, drizzled in melted butter with a dash of grated Parmesan cheese and a dusting of parsley.  It might have been the size of a small or medium potato if you reassembled it. Iced tea refill were handled by no less that four servers (Julianna, the hostess, a cute gal with red carnation in her hair and a random server); this doesn't come as any surprise as I was seated in a main thoroughfare area. The real kicker is the bill; this gets interesting.  The ticket I had just listed the Salmon Langostino with steak fries and veggies for $18.99.  The iced tea wasn't listed.  Subtotal $18.99, tax $1.66, total $20.65.  Put my card in the sleeve along with my $8 (haha, this still cracks me up) gift certificate.  Julianna comes back, with the new adjusted total of $15.79. Hmmm, let's do some math. According to the receipt I was presented, they should have removed $8 from the price of the entree, then compute tax and total...18.99 - 8.00 = 10.99 x .0875 = .96.  Total = 10.55.  The ticket I received after they returned my card was for $15.79.  So, lesse...I got online to look up their menu, but prices aren't listed.  I'm under the impression that they forgot to add my iced tea (let's call it $2 for the sake of example) ... 18.99 + 2 = 20.99 - $8 disc = 12.99 + 1.14 tax = 14.33.  Hmm, still not right.  I won't bore you with more examples, but I kept adjusting the cost of the iced tea, minus the $8 discount and figured 8.75% tax.  The closest result I came up with (without performing stupid amounts of mental gymnastics) was $15.74 (their total was $15.79...I'll deal with a nickel slippage).  This would mean my ice tea was $3.49 (accounting for standard $xx.99 pricing).   The thing that really bothers me is that they don't itemize your order; I can imagine if people did that "2 for $20" nonsense and the servers just ring it up like a normal order.  They also don't show you how they compute a discount; I just got a bill for $15.79 with the ubiquitous blanks for tip and total.  I gave the standard 15% ($2.37...since they got on my bad side) for a new, adjusted grand total of $18.16. Won't be back because: 1.  Lackluster service 2.  Lackluster appearance of restaurant (bus your tables!) 3.  Lackluster appearance, flavor and overpriced food 4.  Location (Long Beach to Cerritos?  No thanks) Sending feedback to their corporate office, mostly to question their billing issues.

Came here for my son's 11th bday dinner. Our waitress was nice but the overall experience was severely lacking. We got our drinks promptly but it took close to 40 minutes to get our food. The appetizer was prompt but that's it. I ordered a burger with a side salad and the burger came before the salad. It was another 10 minutes before the salad came. Seriously? It takes 2 minutes to throw together a side salad. How does that take longer than cooking a burger!!! All I can say is that chain restaurants are really losing their appeal with me and are nowhere near as good as locally owned, smaller establishments. I won't return.
the place can be  packed especially on a weekend and during the holidays. So, go there when it's not busy. Other than that, I like the Tortilla Chips w/ Salsa Dip.

What do you want? It's Fridays. Home of fried foods and booze! It's a great place to get together with friends and have some appetizers and drinks! The entrees are very  forgettable, but the upside is that their servers are stellar! I was laughing and joking with our server while I was boozing it up with my husband. Seriously, what else is there to say about it? lol

Happy hour after softball games! (Starting at 10-2  every night, All Day Sunday) Like this place for Happy Hour. Although the happy hour selection for draft beers is narrowed down to domestic, there's not many places that have Michelob Ultra. I like the fries for $1.50 and sliders for $1.50 each. Appetizers are half off too! In the past year or so, Friday's has expanded their menu that's included flatbreads and other appetizers. Wednesday nights are karaoke nights! Don't make your waiters/waitresses sing all night and sing for them! They have plenty of TVs if you want to watch sports and a nice patio area weather is nice outside. Located right off Towne Center Drive at the Cerritos Towne Center.

STICKY - the first and perfect word to describe this place. whether its the door handles, the tables, the floor... everything is sticky and dirty, i must add! although i tend to get obsessive about dirty things, i can't hate friday's. it's one of the few bars in cerritos open late (2am), with a great happy hour everyday. service can be a hit or miss, but they're good about bigger parties which is nice. oh lastly, i'll leave an advisory warning, try to avoid the karaoke nights. it's absolutely terrible and seriously ruins your appetite!
Happy hour is the best time to go. Its a great place for the munchies  We had good service.  They were attentive on our  food/drinks :)

The food here is pretty expensive in my opinion but it's not anything that's really out of the ordinary. I mean the food is pretty fancy and the workers are actually really friendly, but the high price for the food isn't really worth it in my opinion.

excellent prompt service, love the skillet garlic shrimp here. Delicious everytime! we come here just about twice a week and it's amazing every time ! on time they got the shrimp wrong but the chef offered to remake the dish and compensated our entire meal.

I was in here for my daughters graduation celebration last night enjoying a family dinner, we were on our way out from having a nice celebratory dinner. As we were walking out we heard an employee that was working here maybe even the manager to be the very irritated  just seemed to have snapped at a lady. If I owned this restaurant this gentleman would be gone, he seemed very stressed out the times I saw him walking around my area but he should be able to handle this type of busy environment.
Not even busy but had to wait forever for our food!! Won't come back here.... Waitress lacked a smile and never came back to see if we needed anything...

First of all, it is way overpriced for what it is. Don't know what they are thinking but they may need to knock down their prices by two dollars at least.  We ordered five dishes.  Only the hamburger was decent. The french fries were OK.  The chicken fingers remained uneaten because of the strange flavor.  The macaroni and cheese was really oily.  Basically the overall quality of food was not good and you could tell there was not much pride taken into making it.  On a Friday night, the place was only about 1/4 full. Tells you something for a place called TGI Friday.   Very disappointed!  Mediocre food at ridiculous prices.  Nobody wants that.   However, the service was good. The young man was great.

The only reason I did not leave one star is because the associate who helped us with our concerns, Astrid, made sure to take care of our problems. To start, our servers were dry and insincere. Our food ended up coming out 30 minutes too late, and they only comped the cheapest thing on the check to "make up for their mistake". If it wasn't for Astrid taking initiative for something she had no part in, I would have given this place -3 stars is possible.

Of the many times that I've been here, my rating slowing keeps decreasing.  I think the food is great, happy hour is the best and service... well that's where it gets sh*tty.  FYI if any of your readers are doing those 3 for $20 or 2 for $10... please please please look over your order on the receipt. My recent bill of $115.00 came down to $75.00 when I double checked the orders and apparently, our server didn't put the orders in correctly. Sad to say this isn't the first time it happend.   Other than that I say just to double check your orders, don't expect too much from the servers and enjoy Happy hours!!

The burgers/sandwiches are TERRIBLE, they look nothing like the pictures on the menu. They're way smaller, made with cheap ingredients, and just not worth the 10-12$. As for the sides, they barely put any onion rings and fries on our plates. Definitely not worth it!

Take advantage of happy hour. Half price on drinks and appetizers. Good place to end the night. Karaoke on Wednesdays is a fun place to be. Service can be pretty slow, which is slightly acceptable due to the high volume of people who are hanging out here.
Service was excellent...Chelsie went above and beyond!!! Plus the grilled Norwegian salmon with langostino lobster was so delicious.  I will be back to enjoy both the food and the service.  Loved it!

Been here several times, wanted to see if any of our experiences would be any different since there have been a couple of bad reviews on here. WELL GUESS WHAT...NOT one bad experience and NOT one time did we ever have a bad server. The food has been great every time. I guess some people are just very picky. ;) Bon appetit

Went here for a family dinner. It was happy hour so our appetizers were half off. We had the potato skins and they were pretty good but a little salty. With the BBQ Chicken Flatbread, it was good for flatbread. I also had the Cajun Shrimp Fettuccine (?) dish and I didn't like it as much. It was very creamy, probably just to my tastes,   Our server was really nice, we asked her if we could move tables because of a draft. She gave us good service.

Horrible Horrible Horrible! party I was with got food poisoining from eating the potatoe wedges off the appetizer menu. Careless manager also. Ugh

I've never been a fan of this chain restaurant but was pleasantly pleased with my visit here last Thursday night. I arrived for a late dinner with a few friends. Originally we were going to buffalo wild wings down the st from here but it was super packed with a long wait, so we headed here instead. And happily there was no wait at all so we were immediately seated. Our waitress's name was juliana and she was a sweetheart. Very attentive and friendly. Oh and also patient, my friends and I haven't caught up in a while so were slow at browsing the menu and putting In our orders. I feel like the menu here is much more complex than what I remember to previous years ago. Lots of options which is good. I started off with my latest drink of choice Angry Orchard and the queso dip with chips. My friends had cactus cooler and peach sangria. Oh my the sangria here is great! I believe it was an appetizer ahi tuna somthing can't remember the name but darn it ...it was so delicious! It's ahi tuna served on chips with guacamole (yumm!), raw jalapenos, siracha sauce and a white sweet sauce. This plate was great! I was happy with my visit here, will be coming back soon!

This review is based on the service we received from Michelle. Michelle was a wonderful server. She was so helpful and nice. We love her! She checked on us regularly and made sure we were okay. The food was also good. But the service from Michelle was just so wonderful. Would defintely come back here again and ask to sit in her section

Terrible customer service !!! We waited 45 mins to be seated. Our waitress was very rude. She wouldn't let my friend order a drink for her birthday because her id expired on the day of her birthday. Another friend of ours ordered a drink for my friend's birthday and she confiscated the drink. I had a terrible experience here and I will never return.

Walked into a slightly busy Friday night to not be greeted by the four employees at the front desk. I was asked for my name and number in my party and told the wait would be 10 minutes and that they're ready now. What? After a few confusing minutes, my friend and I were placed at the table nearest the restroom. And informed as such, that we'd be near the restroom. The waiter was a great person, though. The only saving grace for the evening. He even informed all the people in his section that he was going on his lunch break and would leave another waitress in his place, with her in tow to introduce her to his tables. After a few minutes of perusing the "affordable" menu where nothing fell below $15, we happened upon the 2 Entrees for $20 special and decided upon that. The waiter placed our order, brought our drink orders and proceeded with his break. The appetizer was okay as usual. Nothing special there. The table next to us, who were seated after us and ordered after us got their meals before we did. Not good, considering we ordered similar entrees. When our meals finally did arrive, my chicken bruschetta pasta was flavorless angel hair pasta with generous amounts of cold bruschetta and rather dry strips of chicken placed on top and minute amounts of Parmesan cheese. It lacked significant flavor, but being hungry, I consumed most of it. The chicken couldn't be made palatable.  My friend's boyfriend joined us shortly into our meal. He failed to be acknowledged by any of the wait staff. No one asked if he wanted a drink or wanted to order a meal. When our dessert to be shared arrived, it arrived with two spoons and not three. No one even offered him a glass of water. The dessert was a single slice of pie to be shared amongst two people, presented on a large plate with a drizzle of chocolate sauce. It was disappointing at best. While they were attentive with refilling my friend's soda, I had to ask three times for a refill of hot water for my tea. We paid our bill and exited, not receiving any form of thank you or acknowledgment from the five workers near the front desk, including the two workers holding open the inner front doors. I'm a regular here and I love my Fridays especially Donny! He always comes into my restaurant and I return the favor! Great job keep it up!!

The worst happy hour. Apparently their happy hours go on break . So it stops at 7:00 pm and continue  after 10:00 pm ? Well we were there before 7: 00 pm and they never mentioned it . Will not even think twice of coming back here with anyone.
Great food and wonderful service! HUGE shout out to Donny for taking care of us!!! THANKS!!
Great atmosphere! I really like the nachos appetizer... Our server Donnie was great and took awesome care of us! Maybe I'll have my next date here.

Stepping inside TGI FRIDAYS the atmosphere changed everything felt amazing, my girlfriend and I  felt very welcomed. We got sat down and order the unlimited appetizers for $12 a person. I started with the mozzarella sticks and fell in love (don't tell my girlfriend she doesn't know), my girlfriend got the boneless buffalo wild wings..... still eating though, got cheese all over my phone. . Just Left from here.after waiting 45min server still never came to take our orders on our drinks.disappointed on how poorly they sat us down.

Lastly, the bartender ladies were bitchy especially the blonde lady their last night. Overall, experience there is not what its hyped to be..definitely not going back.

I've given this place a few tries and the service has been complete trash. I have no negative comments about the food. If you want okay food and garbage service go ahead.

Great server, but I was not pleased sitting next to a bunch of loud drunk folks cursing like there's no tomorrow. We sat in the back by rear exit smokers propted the door and cigarette smell coming inside while we're eating.  I won't be coming back to this TGIF anytime soon.

This place should deserve no stars at all. They charged our card for another people's order that was sitting on the same table as us. Their servers are incompetent to put it on the wrong tab! Service sucked! Manager couldn't even absorb the fee. Never going back!

Sad to say my first time experiencing tgif Wasn't the best. Despite the reviews I was craving Jack Daniels Ribs and so I went. Overall it was a nice experience and the Cajun shrimp are super delicious. The ribs must have been from a pig on a diet but were still OK. The food was hot and fresh when it came out which is always nice but I did go after the lunch rush.
Great place highly recommend! Donnie is the best he's extremely polite and has a great personality.

First time eating here @noon-ish on May 26, 2013 and that almost didn't happen. Place was extremely loud, screaming babies, kids. So loud I could not hear the person sitting next to me talk. My friend went to use restroom and it was not clean nor did they have any paper towels.  The food was not good. Chicken was old and stale to the point that it was hard around edges. Would not recommend.
Amazing French onion soup . Don't get the hibachi skewers such a downer not worth your money such a small portion
Fridays is cool for fam. . Nothing fancy.  Love their endless appetizers though. . Especially if you have kids:just keep bringing them boneless wings out!

Been here a couple time, but always ate or just drank at th bar.  Place is usually pretty full in the bar and outdoor patio area.   Food is pretty good, and drinks are done up just right.  They have a nice beer selection on tap, and now they have Karaoke nights on weds. Usually order the spinach artichoke dip and the sesame jack chicken strips (delicious), jack daniels sauce is bomb diggity, both 1/2 off regular price. Then I have me an ultimate margarita or an ultimate long island for $5 a drink. Woohoo! Always a good time. Don't come here looking for good entrees, desserts or service because you won't find it. If anything, the service is average, most entrees & dessert border crap, but what do you expect, it's a chain! If you come here other than for happy hr, you may be disappointed but don't say I didn't warn you.  TGIF continues to be one of my go-to spots for happy hr. I'll be back. :)

I love TGI Fridays. Its always been my favorite sit down place. Let me tell you Cerritos is probably the best one I've been too. Every time we are seated within an appropriate time and our server is always polite. The last time we went our server let us know we get free chips and salsa with our rewards card (which we never knew about) and she made a mix with my fries. Their happy hour is probably the best. Tips: Make sure you sign up for their Stripes card (print it out and have it on hand) They always send you BOGO coupons which works very well. Also for your birthday they send you a coupon for a free brownie.  Also, if you want to celebrate a promotion you can meet up with a ton of people at the bar.

Drinks?? Happy hour this is oneof my favorite happy hours, pretty inexpesinve, this location and the lb towne center are my go to spots, i perfer cerritos patio area to long beach, its more open, the servers have always been dolls, its rowdt but not ghetto rowdy,, bar area is smaller then others, but it is a great location near the movies, and sephora's baby sis (ULTA)
Food was ok, service was a little slow even on non-busy evenings.  They offer outdoor seating  which is nice.

Well let me say, this time around it was such a horrible mistake. Showed up for happy hour of course around 10 on a Wednesday night. They started this new karaoke night on Tuesday and Wednesday nights. Sounds cool right? WRONG!!
