At least the celery was good (you would hope because its just celery). The spinach dip was all right. Portion wise there seemed to be more than before so that's a plus. Sliders were decent nothing amazing though. I guess you can't expect too much for happy hour, but come on TGIF, I've had better at bars...BARS!! Overall words of advice: -STEER CLEAR OF KARAOKE NIGHT x________x!!! -DON'T ORDER BUFFALO WINGS -DO GET THE SPINACH DIP TO SHARE -DO TRY A DAILY SPECIAL DRINK

This place is good for happy hour which are during the week (10p-2a). You can get apps half off and cheap drinks. It is a little loud for my taste for talking, because they play music and sports loudly.

Why only 2.5 stars here?  I come here when they give us coupons, for example they have the buy one jack daniels get one free with the purchase of two drinks.  The jack daniels sauce is pretty good.   If you're on a serious budget, the appetizer, desert, and two course meal for $20 is also a steal.  I have those often.  The steak is generally pretty well cooked here for the price.  I've never had the steak cooked wrong.

My family and I went to this restaurant.. It was really busy so we wanted to leave.. we were greeted  by Jerold who was the nicest  guy ever. He took the time to entertain my small children and make our wait as minimal as possible. He even came around to our table and made  sure we were comfortable.. That's great customer service.. These small things were huge for our family... we will be returning.  Great job Jerold

Dont order the Jack Daniels Chicken and "unlimited" Shrimp They literally give you only 5 at a time, in 20min increments.....not worth it at all. Plus, they rudely warn that theyll charge you $10 if they catch you sharing your shrimp.  But you really cant anyways, cus you only get 5 measley pieces! Plus, the chicken is not that great either.  Sauce is whatever.  Dish looks NOTHING close to the picture

Mediocre, that's the only word I could think of when I try and describe this place. I've been to other TGI Fridays, this has to be the worst. They offer happy hour all day on Sundays, so we decided we'd just get some appetizers after we were done shopping. I ordered some pretzels, spinach flatbread, wings and some of those potato skins. First of all, the flatbread was soft, like someone had microwaved it. I've had these flatbreads at other TGI's, they're supposed to be crunchy! The wings were barely sauced and the potato skins weren't as good as other places. The only thing that was decent were the pretzels, they were that same familiar pretzely flavored pretzels you can get at any other TGI's.

They start charging for their strawberry lemonade refills now :( Their food is ok, some menu items are overpriced. Their Jack Daniel's sauce is amazing though! Goes well with... pretty much everything. Burgers, steak, fries, etc.  The service wasn't too great, but it's TGIF so I didn't expect much. This place is pretty much down the street from where I live, so I don't have much of a choice. haha

I actually think this Friday's is okay. I've never had a negative experience and I haven't had to wait to be seated. I've even gone here a couple of times for late night happy hours and hung out at the patio. I do admit that this is one of the older Friday's in the area, but I hear it's also the most popular despite so many people hatin' and debatin' here. I do wish that the bar section was larger and able to accommodate more people. They should also update their televisions to really nice flat screen LCDs to help make it more attractive to sports watchers, for example. I don't know if it's just here, but this Friday's should serve more variety when it comes to beers. I actually think that Friday's should really strive to have as wide a variety as the Yard House, seeing how they aren't a microbrewery or carry exclusive lines of beer. Honestly, I thought the food was good and reasonably priced. There used to be a chicken sandwich they served here up until recently that was pretty good. I used to have that every time I visited. If this Friday's steps up and remodels their patio, which I heard was in the works and design phase, and they update and expand their bar, I believe that people's opinions of this place would slowly turn around.

Never again will I ever come back to this Friday again, i went there with my bf for lunch on Veteran day when there wasn't many people there to begin with (around 12pm), service was slow and when I pay my meal (which was $21.67) with a $100 bill. They came back like 20mins later to tell me that they lost my card, I was confused and I told them that 'I didn't pay by card, I pay in cash, a $100 bill' the server was confused and told me to hold on, then I ask the manager that I had waited for a long time for change and the manager say that they 'some how lost my money and she trying call to her boss' I waited another 15 mins and gave me my correct change. After the long wait, they should have given me a gift card or at least a free appetizer but no they told I should wait another 10-15mins and that they have to mail it, I was like forget it. This is my third strike for this Friday in cerritos! First strike was maybe a year ago when a server threw me a to go box, when I ask politely and it was a busy night. Second time was couple of months ago, I was seated at a booth near where servers come and go with food, it smell so horrible like something rotten. Never ever will I ever come to this Friday in cerritos again and I have been coming there since I was in high school

This is horrible service it takes 45 min for you to get your main dish. They apologize ahead of time for the delay. Not cool if you have kids.. This place sucks go to wood ranch next door. Better service. Food was over cooked and dry.. Worse part they charged you full price at the end.
Went here again for lunch... I had the usual.. Lobster Tails and French Onion Soup.  I love TGI Fridays... their smoothies are not that good at all but I love their food and Peanut Butter Pie.

This is our 1/2 way meeting place for my good friend and I since she lives in Fullerton and I live in Redondo.  Service is Horrible as always!! There is a difference between straight up rude and busy and busy and still serve your customer with courtesy. But this place lacks that, the busy and courtesy part!  They are very unorganized and lacks customer service and etiquette.

Waited 30mins  to be seated when clearly there were 2 big sections open and available. The hostess and manager were rude when after waiting for 20 minutes we asked if we could seat on the open tables and we were told that "there is a waiting time for you to wait". When we decided to just leave they called us to be seated. This is not the first time that it happened and it has been a long time since we've been here we thought to give it another try. And there's this another couple that came and were told to wait for 20mins with all these tables available. If they're lacking servers they should hire more or help out in the floor instead of 3 of them just standing by the podium.

Happy Hour time! If you come at the right time, you can find parking and grab a table at the patio which is my area of choice. Beers are pretty cheap and they have a decent selection on tap. As far as dinner... The food is...well, it's TGI Fridays. Not the worst meal you'll have but definitely nothing memorable. Like I mentioned before, timing is everything here. Either you get seated right away, or you'll be loitering outside for 30-40 minutes for mediocre food.

Wow, where do I start? How about 1 of the 4 Hostesses saying there was a 30 minute wait for us (a party of 5, 3 adults & 2 kids) when there was FOUR empty tables that would have accommodated us. Of course one had dirty dishes that needed to be cleaned off, which took about 15 minutes for a bus boy to come out and clean it half assed. After about only 20 minutes we were seated. The food was just alright, nothing special. You'd think it would've  been great for the price you pay. Or at the very least bigger portions. I mean $11 for a salad that was clearly not the freshest it could be? Or $9 for an average burger & a small handful of less than good french fries? I'd say the only thing of value was the kids meals. If it weren't for the great service from our waitress, I'd only give 1 star. She obviously was stretched too thin due to 4 worthless girls up front. And if you need to use the restroom, you might want to think twice and hold it. Completely filthy!! I won't be returning to this restaurant.

Overall, I'm not really a fan of the food here.. I wide selections of dishes here and well, the food just never seems to cut it.  I find myself here only when friends invite me out for a few drinks or for someone's birthday. If you're into the whole jack daniel's steak, ribs, & sauces type of thing then you would probably become an instant fan.  If there is one thing I love on the menu it would be the spinach artichoke dip.  It's creamy, cheesy, & salty.  YUM! OVERALL - This place is awesome for happy hour and a great place to meet locally with your friends.  Like I always say,  YOU WON'T KNOW UNLESS YOU TRY IT FOR YOURSELF!

Since I've been here in Cali, I've been to this place three times. Every time I've been here, the bartenders have been exceptional, Victor and Landon great bartenders, very attentive and super nice!! And got to say great looking!! ;) oh yeah and the food is good too!!!

Worst customer service.  Sign in to wait for table only to have people who came in after and sign in get seated when our turn. They were friends of am employee who grabbed menus and did the hey and a hand motion to call them bypassing the list. I asked to speak to manager. Spoke to Carlos who did not like my complaint so he asked me to leave.  Will be complaining to corporate offices and have no intention of ever returning to any TGI Friday"s. again.

When I arrived with my family, they told us it would be a 15 minute wait. After 15 the lady came out and told us it would be a 45 minute wait and says she miscalculated. The tables on the side were completely empty and still said it will be a 45 min wait. It was ridiculous, how do you miscalculate that.

A regular customer during happy hour. It's my go to spot whenever I'm out drinking with my alcoholics. They have excellent workers that serves their customers right. Love how they have happy hour all day Sunday cuz Sunday is my Friday at work.

I know better than to eat at TGI Fridays, but it was late and we were sure it was open.  The moment we walked in I knew we were in trouble.  It was karaoke night.  I hate karaoke. The food was bland.  I ordered the flat iron steak with baked potato.  Another rule I have that I broke.  Do not order steak from a national chain.  The steak was prepared properly, but it was tasteless and a bit chewy.  The Jack Daniels sauce helped it go done a little easier. Our server was friendly and attentive.  Oddly enough the place was quite full, even though it was after 10pm on a Wednesday.

Terrible Service!  Never eating here again!  Waiter/waitresses are very un-friendly!  before our last visit to this TGiF, our waiter didn't  give us our utensils until our appetizers (that came out the same time as our entrée).  When I asked the lady who brought our food out for our utensils, our waiter rudely said "here!" and placed it on out table with an attitude.  He didn't even apologize!    Our second/last visit...the hostess showed us to our table, didnt offer high chairs for our kids (3 yrs and 11month old).  Do we really have to ask?  what the hell happen to freakin customer service?  While we where waiting for our food, I noticed the same hostess prepping another table beside us...he was throwing chairs around, looking like he was having a bad day!  Maybe he didnt like his job?  Workers here are just horrible!  My husband and I waited for our food for 45 mins!  we did not order any appetizers, just pasta and some sizzling shrimp.  It should not take 45 mins for the food we ordered, especially when it was not so busy!  My husband was trying to flag our waitress for her attention, she just walked away!  B*#%!  If I can only give this place a negative star instead of one star!  DO NOT EAT AT THIS TGIF!  THEY NEED TO DO SOME SERIOUS RE-TRAINING FOR THEIR EMPLOYEES!
Well worth the drive. Happy Hour was amazing of course and it was pretty cool to have the DJ mix it up as well. Didn't expect much for a Wednesday night late night snacking and drinking.
I love to come here for their happy hour and late business hours... there aren't too many chain restaurants in Orange County that are open late all week ;)

I went here with my family yesterday for Father's Day.  I'm not sure how the waiting/seating experience was cuz my my family was already seated.  We came around 2pm and there were some open tables.  It didn't start getting busy for another hour or so.   Our server sucked.  I wish I caught his name but I was so annoyed with him that I just stopped looking at him.  We ordered.  My husband and I don't like to waste food that we know won't be eaten so we say "no onions, etc" for both of our orders.  To be specific I ordered the Jack Daniel burger - lettuce and tomato only, well done (cuz I'm preggo).  The server got a little confused and said no cheese?  It's a bit my fault, I should have said no pickles or onions to be specific, but I sorted out the order with him   My husband ordered the Jack Daniel burger - no cheese, no pickles.  For a place that wasn't so busy, our orders took awhile to arrive.  On top of that, we ordered appetizers but they came they same time as the meal.   When me and the orders came in, I assumed the one with the lettuce was mine.  It looked like it had been done the way I ordered.  The other burger was a plain cheeseburger.  We assumed that was his except he ordered no cheese.  So it got sent back.  A few minutes later they came back with a plain hamburger.  No bacon, no lettuce, etc.  We had to repeat the entire order for a third time.  It really wasn't that hard.  Eventually our server came back to us and told us that the burger that was sent back was supposed to be mine.  Fine  - but either way both burgers would still have been wrong.  The one that was supposedly mine was still missing bacon, lettuce and tomato.  The one that was supposedly my husband's  had cheese but he said no cheese.  Whatever.  It really wasn't that hard.  I've worked in a restaurant before and I don't see how he could've messed it up.  You would think because of the many screw ups they'd comp the meal or at least offer a free dessert but nothing.   Anyway. the food was ehh.  I have been to TGIF many times and that burger was always so good.  The service was really bad.  I can see if he was super busy and the restaurant was packed for Father's Day why he'd be so monotone and non-smiling but it wasn't busy until later when we were finishing.  Also, no one at our table got a "Happy Father's Day."  I'm just glad that we got to spend time with my dad and that we were all together but I don't think I'll be going back to this location for a long time unless I had to.

My friends and i came here a few nights ago and i was a little disappointed.  First off, we came in a group of 5, however it was packed and seemed to be very busy. We were asked to wait 20 minutes. We came a few minutes later and it cleared out for us to be able to get our seats. however we were asked to wait another 20 minutes, by then my friends and i were starving and we noticed that there were plenty of seats we could be sitting in, but i dont know why we wernt seated. Other than that eeverything else was ok. I orded the jacks rib, and it was WAY more pricy than id imagine. For the price which was about 20$~ i got like  10$~15$ meal.. The waiter was chill and was very patient about taking our orders.  Im most likely coming back here again, but with a bit more cash :)
Pitiful quantity for the price you pay. Tasteless food. I ordered a chicken sizzler and it was pathetic.

This is the place to BE!  IF it was 10 years ago when it was the only bar that you knew you would see people you know there. Now it looks like a depressed version you would see in the movies. I remember when they used to have karaoke on wed nights, and you would have to plan to be there early if you wanted into the patio. The food is not gourmet, but you should know that already! I do like their Jack Daniel's menu, its like an american variation of a teriyaki sauce. The service has gone down a bit since last i've been there, because they used to be super friendly and quick.

It's rare that I give a low rating but when I do it's because it's was well deserved. Service was horrible! my family is very patience and we were treated horribly. Our waiter kept using the excuse of "It's busy" every 30 mins we had to wait for our drinks. We happened to stop the manager "Vincent" to put in our order and with no hesitation he judged us because we had a bucket of beer however I don't drink beer and I have sent two people for drinks and it's going on 45 mins and no drinks came out. And we still had to place an order for food. The manager said you have to be patient. I asked the waiter when I finally received my drinks who is the manager? He says I had already spoken to the manager. I had no idea Vincent was the manager which made me angry! First of all he needs some customer service skills because the way he came off was so RUDE! telling us to have patience after waiting 45 minutes for drinks! How about apologize for the wait and say you'll check on it instead of saying "you guys have to be patience" and put his hands up!!! Never again stepping foot in this place! My family won't be stepping foot in a TGIF for a long while! Smh! Very disappointed!! Calling corporate tomorrow because this was horrible!! SMH!

Worst service and most mediocre food EVER. I'd never come here if it was my own decision, but this seems to be a top choice for meeting up for happy hour or eating late at night.  The food all tastes the same, like "TGI Fridays." The only thing that's even bearable for me to eat is the buffalo chicken sandwich, which is still really boring. How does that happen when something is smothered in spicy, buffalo wing sauce? It's CHICKEN. HOW DO YOU MESS UP A CHICKEN SANDWICH? Many times I've come here with friends at midnight when there's no one in the restaurant part and it takes two hours to get out of there. No thanks. Oh, and my dad loves strawberry lemonade, and one time we were here and had a waiter who was like, "You can get as many refills as you want on this." My dad SPECIFICALLY asked, "for free?" and the kid replied, "yes." My dad, of course, was like, "yay" and had six of them.  That waiter had gone on break or went home, and when our replacement waiter brought the bill, my dad was indeed charged for all six of them. My dad brought it up to the guy and said he asked if they were free and the other waiter said yes, so he went back and took the refills off, which was VERY nice of him. That's the only reason I'm giving two stars instead of one. Bleh. Overpriced, bland food.

I come here for lunch sometimes and thye have very quick service, even for a party of six.Try the fried green beans with wasabi dipping sauce.It very yummy. Right now they have a $20.00 lunch special that you can share for 2.You get to share an appetizer and dessert, includes entree of course.

It's Friday's nothing too special. what makes this spot review worthy? they let you order off their happy hour menu everywhere -- other TGI Fridays will limit you to only the bar for those orders.  Well done TGIF of Cerritos.

Me and nine other co workers were trying to eat here for lunch. it took them 50 minutes to bring us apetizers and water. By the time we got our food it was already time to leave and I was even late getting back to work. So not only did I loose out on time but I lost out on money. We never even met our actual server who aparently was on "break" for the full 50 minutes we were there. Michelle helped us and i giver her major kudos because i dont think she was actually a server. I felt sorry for her. And even though we got the check right after we ordered (because we asked for it) my food was the last to arrive even though it was just a salad and pretzels but then everyone had already left back to work. The cheese we got with our pretzels was ver minimal. maybe a quater of the container. I am deeply upset with this location and am never going back. Same with all my co workers.

Man, I feel bad hearing all the horror stories regarding this TGIF. I thought to myself, franchise spot, mediocre service, poor quality food, and pricey drinks... WRONG! It was more along the lines of...feels more like a local bar, decent service, average food, and generous drinks. 10PM kicks off their happy hour prices (especially on a Tuesday). Which I ordered for my favorite Cerritos Baristas and company: Drinks -1 Glass of Water -1 Jack and Coke -1 Black and Sam-Schooner -1 Blue Moon-Schooner -1 Gin and Tonic Appetizers -1 order of Nachos Grande The nachos we're average honestly, I could make better nachos. They only served as a filler to go with the abundance of alcohol. My friends enjoyed their schnooners while I enjoyed the Gin and Tonic/Jack and Coke combination as a kickback to end the night. Blasting Karaoke Classics from Michael Jackson, Blink 182, and Journey made the cut for the locals who braved their fear of the mic under (or non) intoxication. $36.00 later (tax and tip), exchange of drunk stories and several smoke breaks was a fine way to end the night. Service was prompt, bathrooms were sanitary and Albert the bartender sure had his trick mixology arsenal on the deck that night. Beware of drunk driving (with entrapment set by the Cerritos policy for safety). As a friend said earlier that day...  "You can't go to TGI Friday's on a Tuesday." Unfortunately, that's one rule I'll have to break, now if only I'll get shipwrecked at Shipmate's in the future...
Food is usually good (sometimes the steaks are not cooked accurately though). Salads are GREAT! Love the lunch menu pricing. Service is a hit or miss and we've been here a few times already

HORRIBLE SERVICE AND MANAGER NIKKI. Waiter forgot to send our order to kitchen. 45 minutes later we asked to speak to manager. No show. Went up to hostess to wave down manager. Manager asked if we just wanted to cancel our order!
Horrible. Theyve really gone downhill. They constantly get my order wrong and this last time the manager actually had a little tantrum and LIED about not having what I had ordered.

The side of steak fries were a waste of $4. I thought they would be like Red Robins, they were just sliced potatoe wedges with cheese and garlic. Very small plate. If your going to charge $4 for those make it all you can eat.

What can I say?  What you get at this TGIF is basically what you'd expect out of any chain restaurant .  You can't really complain, I mean you should already know what you're signing up for when you decide to eat there.  I do like how the Cerritos TGIF is making attempts to spice up their venue.  I've sung karaoke there a couple times, and while I did have fun, it's really not my crowd. The only reason why I even bothered writing up a review was to pay my compliments to my favorite server...  Samantha!!!  She's so awesome and lots of fun --- if she's your server, you'll have a good night, guaranteed!

Now I know why people give this place one star. The service is slow. You get your food right away, but the isn't very good.. It's disappointing because I used to come here all the time and the food was exceptional, but now it's not even that... Our server is what made me write this bad review in the first place. I asked her how much 6 oz. was in a glass and she said "It's 6 ounces." I'm all really? Thanks for that. She also kept rushing us and gave us our check so quick because she was off soon. I mean, really lady? You give us crappy service so you can get your tip before you leave? With the way you were serving us, we weren't gonna tip you at all.

We sat in the bar area So maybe the dining area is better... The whole experience was almost comically bad - nobody came to our table for 15 min so I asked the hostess if she could get our server.  We ordered drinks and food and our food came out 20 min later (before our drinks).  Our drinks arrived and the waitress noted that the bar made the wrong drink - it was another 10 min before the right drink arrived.  The steak I ordered medium was super red - the waitress noted it and asked if I wanted the chef to cook it longer.  She took it back and it came back burnt.  I will say our waitress was friendly and none of it was her fault.  The bar area has a good setup and seems like it could be a fun place to hang out but This is by far the worst TGIF I've been to and we won't be back.

I have to admit, the few times I've gone to TGIF, it wasn't that memorable. Food is mediocre but it's tasty enough. We ordered the Jack Daniel Chicken and Fried Shrimp, the Jack Daniels Ribs and a BBQ Chopped Chicken salad. All was pretty tasty. Sauce was sweet and savory while the meats were tender. Salad was a bit watery but overall, meal was satisfying. The host seated us next to a kids' birthday party (after she told us she didn't want us to sit too close to them...it was still close and still loud...LOL). We eventually were moved by the nice waitress. Anyways, Good place for Cerritos since there are not many bars that open late around there. Good for "visiting the parents" kinda of a lunch thing. Use the coupons that come in the mail because it's a bargain!

This is just your average american food joint.  On the weekends, it may be a little overcrowded at night time but during the weekdays, theres plenty of seats to go around, either at the bar or in the dining area.  I usually hit the bar area since there's a no wait.  Although the service is a little slow at times and you're left to fend for the food yourselves instead of them actually helping you out without you waving them over.   Last time I came here, I ordered their dragonfire chicken.  It's a slice of chicken breast on top of brown rice and steamed broccoli with this salsa on top with chili and lime juice.  The chili made it a little spicy while the lime juice added that extra zest to it.   It was quite yummy and the portion was the right size, it made me hunger for more but I was full. yums.  I also had their spinach dip.  it's quite yummy I'll have to admit, one of the better one's i've had thus far.

I've been here so many times with decent service but this last time was HORRIBLE! I know sitting at the bar area you shouldn't expect very quick service but waiting 40 minutes for a server after asking multiple employees for help is just plain ridiculous. Even after speaking with the manager, I had to call on her a second time and even then she only took off $10 for food we never received. I'm not planning on going back any time soon.

This place is the worse when it comes to food and service. We were told it would be 15 minutes to be seated NOPE it took 30 minutes and the place wasn't even packed. After sitting down here comes the waitress wow talk about having an attitude. She didn't tell us her name wouldn't even smile or acknowledge our table. My bf asked for a root beer and she kept saying well it doesn't have a refill well we knew that. it's ok to tell us once but she kept repeating it I heard it about 5 times. When we ordered food my bf ordered steak with Mac n cheese and mashed potatoes. I ordered steak with crispy shrimp baked potatoes and Mac and cheese. Our food arrived 40 minutes later!!!! Really???!!!!! Wow I have never waited so long for food and my bf's food came out fine but mine not even close. I received a well done steak when I asked for a medium steak I got chicken that was disgustingly dry when I asked for shrimp and then I got mashed potatoes instead of a baked potato.  The waitress gave me so much attitude for her mistake. I regret going here my food was just disgusting the shrimp that she brought me after was full of oil I couldn't even taste the shrimp and the steak beyond chewy. We will never be coming back here will take my business elsewhere.

What do you do on Valentine's Day if you have no date?  Well, I ended up here with two of my friends. I resent this place because of the white and red striped decor. I don't like candy canes. I don't like red. So mix those patterns together and make it vertically striped, which creates a dizzying effect of a restaurant named TGIF.  Also, I don't feel like it's a Friday inside a TGIF. It feels like a Monday, which creates more tension inside me, and add that to the boisterous laughter of the group next booth yonder...and I'm more annoyed. The food is mediocre, drinks has a tendency to taste like Caprisun, and servers look tired. Happy Friday!!!!

I work right across from this location - and since it's National Cheeseburger Day, I decided to order one to go. I'd done this before a few months ago and was very happy with my order.  This time, not so much. It was lunchtime on a weekday, and while the place wasn't very busy, there was only one shy hostess seating people.  She barely made eye contact with anyone and didn't seem to know what she was doing. It took quite some time for her to sort the line of people at the hostess stand.  There was one other customer also waiting for takeout, and the hostess brought both orders out together. She and a manager just stood there and fumbled around for a few minutes and I had to ask for my food, which was sitting right there. I'd already paid for it, so I don't know why neither of them thought to hand it to me.  The meal itself was very disappointing.  As I stated earlier, I'd had the same burger before and it was YUMMY, so I was excited about my food. Unfortunately, the burger was not made as I'd asked (I wanted medium-well and it was still pink). I didn't have time to go back, since I was at work. The fries were totally soggy and so was the bun (even without condiments). The lettuce was bitter and the tomato wasn't fresh and they put the wrong cheese on it. I only gave it 2 stars because in spite of everything, the burger tasted good. Not ten dollars good, though!  Very disappointed! :(
Slow service, but they're nice

My husband and I are always here than any other tgif..because it's closer to where we live and where he works..smaller, but works for me.  I love their patio section, it's not like the one at the block where it's seated rite in the crowd, very few outside tables but normally when we get there around 8pm on a friday or so, there's always seatings.  When I first came here back in 2007, I thought the service was wayyy too slow, and it was, this tgif wasn't as crowded when we came back then, but I decided to come on here today to give them a rating because we got very excellent treatment when we were there on 12/19/09 around 5:30 pm for happy hour time. This alone is a rating on their service not food, since tgif food is the same everywhere.  We got there and wanted to sit in the patio area, but it was full and all reserved, so we stood waiting, told for wait about 15-20 mn, we stood there for about 5 minutes, the lady waitress that was working patio section saw that we wanted to sit there, instead took us over to a small booth next to the bar area and seated us.  She was very nice to notice us and was super friendly to us. As we were super hungry, she totally helped and it was so wonderful of her. She didn't have to do that but she did, and to me that is beyond excellent service!! Our waitress was also nice, and so was all the staff there who kept taking plates off our table... most of all our nachos were very dee-leesh-us!!!! Appetizers & alcohol half price, full meal price...couldn't been happier that moment.

Not good on a Friday to eat here! After waiting for 15 minutes for service I walked to the bar and ordered drinks myself. I went back to my table and after 5 more minutes I was finally able to get the attention of a waitress. We told her we wanted to eat and I had to take matters into my own hands to get drinks. She explained the shortage of waiters and I replied to her " I understand it's not your fault and maybe you should ask your manager to get someone to help you". I'm only gonna come here on sundays because its HAPPY HOUR ALLDAY!!!!! YAY!! service was pretty good. Loved sitting in the bar area. Waiters are super speedy and polite. Welcome, pull up a chair and take a load off. This ones a real keeper of a review. Bookmark it, save it...whatever.  I was in Cerritos on business and for lunch my co-workers wanted to go here. Ugh. Ok, I said.  First off, its the start of the lunch hour so I'm expecting it to be quite busy, however when we walked in maybe 20 people or so were in the restaurant (and you know how big these places are). The hostess was no where to be seen. We waited...and waited...and waited. Finally about 5 minutes later the hostess goes "have you been helped" I looked at her and said "are we sitting at a table?". She nodded and grabbed some menus. We sat outside cause I mean, come on? It's SO CAL! We waited about 10 minutes for our waitress to even come to our table....no waters, no silverware...no joke. She finally finds time to come and take our order. Food came...wasn't bad. I ate and was ready to leave. I asked for the check. The check came to $29.32 (there were three of us).
