He just said, well sometimes they don't tip out until the end of the day...what? I just said that... It's almost like stealing too....how the hell did she come up with that #?  It doesn't even make sense with my original total...??? I asked him to refund the difference of what I had actually signed off on and refund to my CC. He said he would look into it to see what went wrong (and if I was lying, I'm sure) and call me back. About 2 hours later he calls me back telling me I was right...we know this already, keep going. He asked me to come in so we can refund. I explained that I lived 3 states over and that I am unable at this time to come into your horrid establishment. He says he can't refund my CC without the actual card...what? For serious? No...really...what? Since when did Friday's make the CC rules? So he said he was going to send me a check from the corporate off for the difference. Ok, fine I'm too irritated to argue.  Two days later I receive a FedEx from said Friday's. Open it. *insert scream*. CASH! The MF sent CASH! I mean everyone likes cash, but I much rathered it go back on my CC...cause now I still have to pay for it.  Check would have been a little better, I would have just deposited.  You wish I deposited cash.  Oh and he sent coupons. Why is it I ALWAYS get coupons when things go wrong? Is that just what people do? I feel like I'm a coupon queen. Anycoupon...there was also a note in there...the a*hole I spoke to was the BAR Manager...not the GM like I had asked. They didn't even say if the GM was in...they just passed me to the BAR Manager. He wrote a lovely little note with stupid coupons. Done.  My REAL question is that...did this waitress get to keep her $58.34 tip? Did they make her pay it back with that cash? I wrote the corporate office for Friday's and explained what had happened. Twice. No response.  You suck, sketchballs.  I didn't even like your terrible overproduced food anyhow.

I only go for late night drinks, as there aren't too many options at that time of night in Cerritos. Pros: Open late, nice late happy hour special.  Outdoor seating nice for the warmer times. Cons: Hard to get seating sometimes.  Service can be slow. Good thing it's one of the only games in town late night in Cerritos.

Food is decent as always, but SERVICE HERE IS HORRIBLE!! Our waitress was such a rude lady! She never came to check up on us (NOT ONCE) She didn't respond to any of our comments  Messed up my order and didn't apologize! I asked her a few questions and she just raised her index finger (I guess telling me to wait) then just walked away and never came back! Urrrg I hate rude service!!

These SUCKERS!!! Watch out for the "happy hour" exceptions-- The SERVERS don't make it too clear that not ALLL APPETIZERS are HALF PRICE!!! ...does that not defeat the whole purpose of "HappyHour" and actually make it UNHAPPY HOUR?!?

I love the 2 for $20 deal! It's pretty ridiculous: 1 appetizer, 2 entrees (limited selection), and any 1 dessert all for $20. I calculated it one time, if you bought all those things separately it would come out to $35-$40. It makes it a good but cheap place to go for dinner with my wife.  I usually get the petite sirloin, buffalo wings as my appetizer, and most of the desserts are good.  The happy hour is a good deal too with half-off on their appetizers. Everyday 3pm-7pm and after 10pm. ALL day Sunday!

First and last time eating here. Right when we sat down she was unfriendly. She  was extremely inattentive and looked like she wanted be anywhere but there it was during lunch we ordered the two for $20 we had to ask for refills the dressing that came with the order didn't come out and took our waitress over 10 minutes to get. She started getting others orders when she didn't even complete ours. As well as, taking forever for the food to arrive & it's not even busy here. Food is one thing customer service here is dog sh*t . Love TGIF but never this location. Go somewhere else and get your money's worth.

This place is whack. Honestly, the only time I have ever visited TGIF in the last decade, which as been two or three times, is for Veteran's Day so I can get a lil free grub. But, I promise you Yelpers, this will never be the case ever again. I'd much rather pay for a meal that doesn't waste my time or hunger (even though I will get hungry again hours later.)

The food here is good.  As many people before me have posted it's the service that kills this place.  The servers are slow, they don't care.   If you don't care about going back to work late on an hour lunch I guess it's okay.

PROS -decent food, cheap appetizers (with ok selection) and very cheap alcohol during happy hours CONS -no other reason to go to this TGIF other than HH -servers at this establishment are DUMB AS ROCKS (absolutely no exaggeration)          -asked for my debit card to be swiped for $8 but came out to $14 ($8 was explicitly stated on the receipt paper) and had to re-do it.. server came back with new checks like she never made a mistake in the first place OVERALL -only come for HH and don't expect great service, if service, at all

This place was absolutely horrible! Zero management & 4-5 people standing at the front doing absolutely nothing. Their menus are filthy, the food was cold, the fries were raw & the waitress's kept giving my daughter dirty looks! She is 17!!! Quit it! Anthony was a good server considering what he was given. Please replace the management.

Everyone knows TGI's. Food is really not that great. Beer selection is pretty limited and the mixed drinks are pretty bad. But, I must give it some credit for trying to spice up Cerritos. At least it's open late (2am). I'd recommend going for happy hour  after 10pm because the 1/2 appetizers are worth it. $1.50 for a large basket of fries is always good. Beer prices are pretty cheap during happy hour too but you're pretty much limited to domestic AKA beer pong beer. There's also an outdoor patio that is nice for chillin on late night drinks/snacks and karaoke sometimes if you're into that.  Giving it 2 stars because I can barely swallow the food. But, it is an option for something to do when you just want to grab cheap drinks and munch on something when you're too lazy to just make hot pockets (cuz it's pretty much the same thing). And hopefully you don't really come for Friday nights.

On Tuesday, March 11th. at around 7:00 p.m. I was looking forward to a steak dinner after fasting for so long. Unfortunately the server at the bar did not want to take my order. Felt real neglected and completely disappointed. As a manager myself, I would not tolerate this sort of negligence in my establishment. Management needs to step up and micromanage the "service". This is not how any customer should ever feel.

We eat here about once per week during lunch. Our food is always delicious but our servers often forget to come back with refills on our drinks. We have to search them out to get our bill which sometimes makes us late getting back to work after lunch. Overall a great experience if you aren't on a timed lunch break.

So really. this place is NOT that great. but it's open till 2am. For anyone that lives in Cerritos, we all know that by 9pm, everything pretty much shuts down. And when you want to enjoy some drinks and munchie type foods, there's only one place that's smack in the middle of TC where you can get that done. Late Night Happy Hour is quite fun if you're down for nocturnal drunkards. Wednesday night is Kareoke night - be warned.

TGI Friday's has a decent Happy Hour. What makes it the best HH is that it is offered All Day on Sunday's during NFL ticket!!  We ordered the basket of fries (nice, hot & crisp), cheeseburger sliders (more meat than a regular McDonald's cheeseburger! Happy with these!) and Jack Daniels chicken strips (way overdone to the point of not being able to distinguish hard fried batter and hard fried chicken, Yuk!).  They serve ice cold 22 oz draft beers for $3. Their 2 for $20 deal is meh. Nothing spectacular really stands out on their offerings. I was reading their posters stating "Join us for Karaoke on Tues and Wed!", but I think for the mediocre food selection and the possibly horrible wannabe karaoke singers I have come across in my travels, I will pass on this place on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and cross my fingers I can find a spot at the bar on Football Sundays.

I went here on Thursday with three friends for goodbye drinks before I leave town. We went in the late afternoon so it was pretty empty when we got there but started filling up. Bar itself was empty but there were a few groups (including us) sitting at tables in the bar area. I had a slide for $1.50 and a basket of fries for $1.50 as well. One of my had the mozzarella sticks and another had the spinach flatbread or something I think? The slider, fries, and mozzarella were good--nothing spectacular. But my friend didn't like her flatbread at all. I had the orange dreamsicle ($6) which I enjoyed. Another friend had the electric lemonade (also $6) which she liked. They also had beer bottles. My friend had a Bud Light Platinum ($?). The website had some particular three dollar drinks deals which we asked the waitress about, but the manager said they're a franchisee so they don't necessarily do everything that's on the website which sucks. Our waitress actually kinda sucked in that it felt like she was avoiding us and was never near our direction for her to flag her down. But I had a good time because of the people I was with. An okay time, but not my favorite spot.

I probably shouldn't come on Sunday nights anymore.  1. Waiters needs to be more informed about prices. My sisters and I chose the 3 courses for $20. I'm allergic to shrimp so we decided to get the wings instead since it was the same price, only to have the waitress tell me that it had to be below even though the menu said otherwise... luckily my mom caught it and pointed it out. 2. Please bring more than one set of napkins to a table... our whole table (8 people) had finger food and everyone only had one sheet of napkin each 3. a mistake was made on my check and i brought it to the waitress' attention. when she gave me the new check, she did not give me an  itemized receipt. now i can not get points for my $130 meal. i call back the following night and they say they can't look up my itemized receipt because I didn't have an itemized receipt..... The only reason I didn't give only 1 star was because I have been here a few times before and had gone home happy. But this time I went home irritated and the feeling continued even to the following day.

So I'm a big fan of tgi Fridays. . On Saturday I decided to take my husband here for his birthday dinner with my sister and children. This was our first time here.  We are regulars at the long beach location!!  When the hostess sat us at the table, it was dirty. We didn't want to wait much longer so we wiped it off with our baby's baby whipes.  As soon as our server got to the tablet and greeted himself as Bryantt with a huge smile and offered us drinks. Once we got our drinks, we ordered 3 endless appetizers which took about 25 minutes to come to our table. They didn't even last 5minutes before they were finished so we waited for our server to appear to order a refill. He was no where to be found. About 10minutes later, we asked him for a refill and he said he had already ordered one, which was odd because we didn't let him know what kind of sauce we wanted for our boneless wings. So we requested a sauce. And he rushed to leave, we didnt even get to order our entrees .Our refills took another 15 minutes, and we were missing one. When he came , I had ordered a petite sirloin for here and a shrimp Friday for my husband who was being impatient because the food was taking too long. Again he rushed off, I had to call him several times, but he did not respond.we figured he might have been busy with other tables, but once we looked around it was pretty empty in the section we sat in. I wanted to let him know I wanted to change my plate for the rib trio. So I had to get up and look for him. Once I told him I let him know what I wanted he seemed a bit disturbed and annoyed. My rib trio came about 5 minutes after which was very strange because our appetizers took almost half an hour. Our shrimp Fridays to go took for ever to come out so I asked another server for the check since our's was nowhere to be found again.  Once he came with our bill, I noticed he never ordered our Friday s shrimp to go. We were so fed up with the service and the delays I didnt bother to let them know it was my husband s birthday since he was already mad that the food took forever. I was eager to speak to a manager about our situation, but my sister was also annoyed she wanted to get up and leave. I have been a server since I was 18, I am now 26 and I know this is not a way to deliver customer service.  Now we know to stick to the one in long beach, which is super attentive to their guests!!!

I recently came to TGI Fridays for the first time.  I will never go back.  Upon entry, we were given the option to sit in the dining area or the bar and informed happy hour prices would be in effect in "a few minutes," for the bar side only.  Thinking we were primarily spending on food, rather than drinks, I initially opted for the dining side.  However, after seeing the happy hour prices included half-off on appetizers, we asked to be switched to the bar area a few minutes later. Upon getting our bill, we noticed we had not been given any happy hour prices.  The server was very polite and apologetic, but said it was because we had initially sat in the dining area and placed the first part of our order there.  She offered to let us speak to the manager, which I accepted.  This is where I became irritated. The managed declined to oblige my request to speak with him.  He hid in back and made the server deal with us.  She returned to say he refused to honor the happy hour prices because they were placed moments before happy hour began.  The first part of the order was placed 9 mins prior to happy hour.  The second part was two minutes prior.  I had assumed when we were initially happy hour would begin in "a few minutes," they would not be that strict to the minute, and if so, kindly advise us to wait a few more minutes since we had relocated specifically to get the discount. Irritated the manager didn't even have the courtesy to come speak to me, the server apologized again and asked if she should make a second request for him to come speak to us.  I declined and told her I wouldn't ever return to the restaurant.  She relayed this message to the manager and even still he blew off speaking to us.  So we were informed of their special discounts, relocated to the bar for nothing, paid full price on appetizers we thought would be discounted and never even got blown off in our request to speak to the manager.  It's these kinds of draconian business practices, focusing entirely on opting for a few extra dollars at the expense of customer satisfaction, that leads chains like this to a poor reputation.  This is my only experience with this company and it was once too many.  Truly awful (mis)management.

Geez, I think maybe other reviewers are taking this restaurant too seriously!  My aunt and I enjoyed chatting it up with a male bartender at this location.  His name is Tory and he made a wicked mudslide, FYI, at this TGIF.  Also, shrimp scampi delish and good deal on lunch sized bruschetta pasta.  It tasted like spaghetti but was better than spaghetti.  Comfortable stools and no weirdos in vicinity always makes this experience a pleasant one: )
Very good.I had a good experience and the service was good. I really liked the jack daniels sampler.

TGIF is getting 4 stars? WTF! I know I know, hold on let me explain myself. Yes of course I know the food is over priced for its quality, yes I know the hosts suck balls, and yes I even know that the service is slower than your great aunt Mary. I know, so what's with the 4 stars? Well, let's be real here. Why do you go to Friday's: To have a great meal? To have a romantic date? To celebrate your Birthday? To be treated like a princess? If you answered yes to any of these questions, you're an idiot and in serious need of a reality check.  Friday's is not that kind of place. I barely consider this place a restaurant. If you look and treat this place like a bar, it's pretty damn good. My friends and I always go when we're not in the bar mood but could use a couple of beers or we're broke (happy hour most appetizers & beers are half off) or it's too late to go anywhere else (closes at 2am). I recommend going in small groups during happy hour and sit either at the bar or in the outdoor patio. The patio isn't too big but I always find a table or two empty for us to take. Though one time I went with a huge party that literally took up the entire patio.. It was pretty hilarious to see people get all pissed when they came out to the patio and there were no more seats because our group took them all.  Overall, the place sucks as a restaurant but change your mindset and you'll have a good time. This place is actually my go-to on Sunday's. (It's Happy Hour all day, shhhhhhhhh!)

Aren't All TGI Fridays the same? I came to this location on Thanksgiving evening with my cousin to have a cocktail. The staff was SUPER friendly. They came outside and turned on the heater for us, kept checking on us, at one point one of them came out and had a conversation with us. The place was super empty, which made our service GREAT. A perfect way to end a long Thanksgiving's day!

the fourth star: DOGS ALLOWED IN OUTDOOR SEATING AREA !!  **as long as theres no complaints. my golden retriever loved tgif. im a fan of the happy hour. foods okay. good service last two times i went. if the waits longer than 10-15 mins, ill probably skip out.  something about tgif always keeps me coming back.
Eric Hernandez is one awesome dude ! Very friendly and polite, helped us in even tho it was busy and had a great attitude !! Claps for him !!

I came here on a Tuesday night for my best friend's birthday dinner after a night of bowling. The host sat us down at a table and we were greeted by our server Jay. He was extremely attentive and nice. There were 5 of us and we ordered the Trio Appetizer, Ceasar Salad, Clam Chowder, 10oz Sirloin, Salmon Langostion, and a burger. Jay would ask specific questions to how fast we want our food to come out, and such. All of us had our drinks refilled and everythin was great. Food was just standard but the service was so great! He got us a free desset for my friend too. In the end, we all wanted to thank him personally and actually waited outside the kitchen to say thanks. Haha. Thank Jay for your amazing service!

I don't know how many times I come here, but it had been so many times. Go during the happy hour! Half off appetizers, half off beers, half off margaritas and wine. What more do you want?!!!  The best deal at TGI Fridays is the 3 for $20 deal. Man you get so much on this deal. One Appetizer + 2 Entrees + 1 Dessert! What I usually get is the Bruchetta Chicken Pasta, Nachos for appetizer, and for dessert, brownie with ice cream on top! Yum. One time you probably don't believe me, but I ate the whole thing by myself at a friend's bday dinner. Never again by myself, lol always share with a buddy!  Other info: Service is fast and friendly Place is clean and nice cool bar atmosphere

Been to Friday's twice total, first time at this location. The service was good and our waiter was prompt on the refills and getting us our food, but the food at this Friday's and all Friday's in general is just not good. We ordered the sampler trio and the Jack Daniels ribs and shrimp. All of the items in the sampler trio were clearly frozen for a while and reheated when we ordered. They all had that slight freezer burn taste. The shrimp in the Jack Daniel's combo was no different as well. The ribs were not bad, but they weren't amazing either. We ordered a house salad to go along with the ribs which was fine. Our bill with tip came out to be over $40 for 2 people, which seems a bit high for frozen foods. Gave it two tries, but that will probably be the last.

Just like any other TGI Friday's, the food here sucks and the decor is beyond tacky.  Why am I still giving it three stars, though?  Simple: $3 cocktail specials all day and night.   I was craving a beer, but right when I opened the menu and saw the special, I couldn't resist.  So what if there were only six "old school" cocktails to choose from?  So what if none of them sounded appealing at all?  I just can't pass on a good drink deal when I see one!  I hate gin, and I'm not a cosmo fan, so I had to go with the tequila sunrise.  The taste of Jose made me want to throw up a little, but it was still worth the $3! $1 + $1 + $1 = 3 star review
Messed up the same order 3 times took forever to get it right asked for drink refill took forever I will stick to the TGI Fridays at the block of Orange way better.

Horrible service. I understand this place gets busy but they really need to get it together. I went in one night to have dinner with my boyfriend and it took awhile for someone to give us our drinks. Then a waitress took our order and i checked the time because i made a phone call after she took our order and it was at like 10:10 pm. so we waited and it seemed really long so i told my boyfriend to go ask the host what's going on and they sent over the manager right away. He told us he was very sorry they forgot our order and the food was on them. Basically, they totally forgot about us. When I checked the time it was 11:15 pm . A whole hour that we had waited for our food. To top it off my food was not good at all. I got the broccoli cheddar soup and it was sour. My boyfriend's food was on the cold side so we didn't even stay there. we got up and left. They only thing that is ok to get there would be there appetizers.

You really have a tough choice when you arrive to this place. Which section is to go to? The bar where all the fratboys are at? Or at the dining sections where the family with screaming kids are at, wannabe High school punks, and all the nauseating forms of all walks of life is going to be at. You can take a chance and hope you don't wound up at next to them. Roll that dice. Some of the time it's fine as you are seated next to normal adults, but the seatings are very public as you can hear almost anything and everything. Sometimes I feel you have to shout just to be heard. Not great if you are going for the quiet, peaceful meal. The bar was not any better on a weekend where the games are on. If you are going there, there's the Jack Daniel Sampler that you can get ribs, shrimp, and chicken strips to start off. If you need to get everything to satisfy everyone, then get the "Three for All" appetizer as you can get three of each samples. The meals can include burgers, steaks, ribs, pasta, and seafood. Nothing extraordinary. You can also ordered salad and soup to satisfy your low carbs needs. The sandwiches are also  very filling. The newest sandwich you can order is a Eggplant Parmesan. Cool beans. Not a very comforting place to go to. Very rowdy during weekends. Probably a safer bet to go on a weekday. Oh, as title suggested, it might not be a Thank Goodness For a Friday as it can be a drag. Avoid that if you can.

Came for Happy Hour. It was okay. Just like any other TGI Fridays. The service was just adequate. Nothing special from any other place. Good thing is that they have a whole bunch of flatscreens around and have a lot of games on especially in the bar area.

How about the saddest Happy Happy Birthday song you ever want to hear. The service at this Fridays's sucks.   The food at all Friday's sucks The drinks at Fridays is as good as the bartender Why do we keep coming back to Fridays? We're Idiots. We like bootlegs as explained in this review-   It's Convient We like abuse We like drama We like being pimped We're just not that smart. i give it an extra star because I'll probably be at a Fridays some place some where within the next 6 months, for some jack asses bright idea for a "lets hang out for drinks" night.

I've been to quite a few TGIFs as I travel a lot for work.  This is by far the worst restaurant of the chain I have ever been to. My first experience here I would rate 3 stars as the food was good but the service was miserable. I decided to give it a second chance as the company I work for has a nearby corporate headqurters. My second visit was possibly one of my worst experiences in any restaurant I have ever been to. Rarely do I complain about services or even write yelp reviews but after how I was treated this is much deserved. First it took forever to order because the bar tender had a hard time asking if the group had everything they needed. She asked only individuals. Then we ordered and the food came pretty quick. The problem was how the food was cooked. My potatoes were over cooked, hard, and tasted like heat lamps, my mozzarella sticks turned out to be Asiago and another mix of cheeses that were far from mozzarella, and the hot wings were under cooked and the meat was very squishy. When all this was brought to the attention of the bartender we received a very rude reply. I will never again eat at this establishment.

I LOVE this place! The happy hour is the best. If you are a regular or find yourself at any TGI Fridays location often I STRONGLY suggest signing up for the GIVE ME MORE STRIPS program. Its free and in the end you get free food and coupons every month. This location has the best bartenders whom are very attentive.

Recently they added a DJ in the bar and the music is pounding loudly throughout the entire restaurant.  If you're in your early 20s and looking to hang out in a loud bar, this is now the perfect place to go. Not for us, however. We'll go somewhere else now.   We have been coming to this Fridays for over a year, at least once a month on Monday nights. Staff is awesome and so is service. Food is okay. We came here first because they're open late, but we'll need to find someplace else.

i honestly don't know if i have bad luck or always get bad service at this location. i understand hey it's friday its the upgrade version of denny's but still, the wait time is at least 20minutes. i basically order 3 items from the menu. bake potato, pasta or the jack daniel entree. every time i have to ask for silver ware or sauce. my bake potato always seems to be missing some crucial ingredient: i.e.: sour cream,chives, cheese. if i ask the server they apologize but never seem to bring back the item. i just don't see the point of eating here any mores.

Wow!! This T.G.I.Friday has gotten horrible!! Haven't been here since Jan of this year and I guess its no longer like a family restaurant but a ghetto club. It's ridiculous!! Here for dinner with my friend and can't even hear our conversation. It's not like how it use to be. It's so loud and annoying with the music and everyone talking over each other. With how it is I for sure won't come back and this use to be my favorite T.G.I.Fridays to come to. Service is bad too. Took 45 mins to get our food and the waiter never came to check up on us. I noticed the time because I was already annoyed with how loud its in here with the DJ playing the music. Don't come here at all if you're looking for a peaceful dinner!!

When you go to TGIFridays, you get what you expect.  I anticipate delicious, high calorie comfort food, and surprisingly strong fruity drinks.  And it is glorious. This particular location has never done me wrong.  I used to go here for takeout a lot when lived in California a few years ago, but now not so much.  However, my like of the place has not diminished at all.  It's the kind of place you can take a group to have a good time over dinner.  I enjoy greatly the fried green beans, blackened chicken alfredo, and vanilla bean cheesecake. True story, I met the manager (not sure if he's still the manager) of this particular TGIFridays at a different TGIFridays (The Block) for a World of Warcraft Deathwing Realm meet and greet 3 years ago.  Apparently, a perk of being a TGIFridays manager is that everyone you eat with at any TGIFridays doesn't have to pay for food.  BEST COINCIDENCE EVER, since we had no idea who would show up to begin with. Unfortunately, this location didn't seem to have the NFL Sunday Ticket, which would have seen me at the location on a few Sundays.  Other than that, a great place to have dinner with a few friends.

This is my first time coming to this TGI Friday's location and I love it! I usually don't like food from chains like this but their late night happy hours make up for it.  We had strawberry margaritas for only $5 and the glass was huge with fresh fruits on top. Our server mentioned he was still in training but I think he did an excellent job. He came by our table several times during the night. The food was ok. However, it's a good hang out place after seeing a movie right next door.

I know this is a restaurant and bar. Definitely not my first choice for dinner or drinks. But at 11PM in Cerritos this is pretty much your only choice. I had dinner and drinks with friends. But my girlfriend and I wanted to get some dessert and some more drinks.  We had a brownie with ice cream, chocolate sauce, caramel sauce, and pecans.... MMM ...  She had this monster margarita and I had a mudslide. Tasty drinks for dessert. Couldn't taste the alcohol at all. That's not a bad thing. I just don't know if there was very much in them.  Happy hour is from 10 till close in the evenings. So this monster margarita was only 5 bucks! BANG!  I think this place would be good to watch a football game at. Or for people who like sweet drinks.  Like the saying goes... whats the funnest thing to do in Cerritos? Leave.

This is my review of a $5.99 Chicken Bruchetta Pasta I had for lunch. Service: Service was fairly good.  I was promptly seated at my to a table of my choosing the moment I walked in.  The host was nice and the waitress took my drink order right away.  They didn't really take any time explaining the lunch specials or getting to know me. Food: At $5.99 for a sit down restaurant it's a decent deal.  Despite it's presentation, the flavor and composition has much to be desired.  I wouldn't even say it's aspiration.  It's more like the high fashion section at a Walmart than a Coach store in a fancy shopping mall, which is what I expect at a sit down restaurant.  The dish artfully arranged angel hair pasta topped with pieces of grilled chicken with some dark colored sauce and sprinkles of tiny pieces of parmigiana, parsley, and small hints of diced tomato.  Although it looks good, it has that feeling of being cheaply put together.  The sauce has no texture, doesn't tie in at all besides adding a hint of sweet and salt.  I prefer something a bit more thick and creamy that really coats the pasta.  Something that feels like a skin of a young woman as your bring her in close, that certain something that brings it all together and makes it a blissful experience.  It's more like an middle aged madam, and you can't help but ask, "Do you have some prettier girls in the back?"  The grilled pieces of chicken were ok.  Well salted, a little crispy but not burnt.  At this point it's like putting a condom on a bad experience. Drink: The reason I'm giving it a 2 is a simple unsweetened ice tea cost me $2.87.  That's like 1/2 the price of my lunch.  It's like I felt for the "But, wait, there's more" of a cheap infomercial.  Sounds cool to get that extra, then you realize the shipping and handling has screwed you over 1/2 the price of the product.

In one word - TERRIBLE. Hands down, one of the worst dining experiences, ever.  We were seated in a section that had poor coverage, had two somewhat confused waiters who couldn't get our order straight, it took about 20 minutes to get my drink (Diet Pepsi), and the food tasted old when we finally got it.  We left without eating becaue the of the beyond-poor service and will never return to this location
Service here is laid back but not too bad. I come here often for a few drinks with my siblings =) many good times here but only during happy hour!

I go to T.G.I.F for 1 reason and that's for any entree with Jack Daniels sauce on it. I went to this location yesterday and I admitted to them I ordered the wrong thing. I just ordered a flat iron steak and not a JD one. I also don't like that they don't ask you how you want your steak cook. I then have to wave down my waitress to come back because she was taking forever to make sure everything was okay, which it wasn't. I then tell her I ordered the wrong thing, but ill eat it just requested some JD sauce. Knowing I'm already an unhappy customer instead of going to get the sauce first she goes to add the JD sauce to my bill!! Then goes and gets my sauce by the time she's back my food is cold! I lost my appetite and my patients being there! The cooks manager was nice. He came out to talk to me because he noticed I sent my food back and didn't even touch it. I just felt like the waitress didn't even care or try to make my experience better. I will def. not be going back to this place and I do not know if ill go back to a T.G.I.F. Worst experience in a restaurant ever!!

i'm a fan of the HH menu. everyday after 10 pm the domestic beers is $1.50? there's always a $5 special daily cocktail, and other drink specials. the appetizers are 1/2 off after 10 pm. most places are very strict w/ HH...saying you can only get it at the bar. but at TGI the waiters usually let you have HH sitting in the dining room area! which is a great plus! i always get the sliders, bc it's a perfect meal size and they're really yummy. i have gotten the quesadillas...pretty good, but not worth the calories. YES YOU HEARD ME CALORIES! EVERYTHING @ TGI'S MENU HAS THE CALORIES WRITTEN ON IT :( which sucks because even though you want something and you see it's 800+ calories...you feel so guilty that you either a. order it or b. feel like shit after eating it hahaha

Wow! Where do I begin? From the start we walk in a sit at a booth in the bar, no one greets us or helps us for 10 minutes.  Then we order our drinks and food and it takes forever to get our drinks, because the waitress is too busy shopping for makeup with another customer who brought it in. Then we get our drinks and food and im served my hard cider with a glass that is cracked all the way down the side, not a crack inside but one that had very sharp edges. We told the bartender and she threw it out and we also let the manager know. By this time we had been here for two hours and had to use the restroom. Well evidently the mens restroom was out of order so they are having the men and women go into the womens restroom together. This is not a single stalled restroom.  This one had several stalls that men and women were supposed to use. I believe this is against the law. I will be reporting this to the state of california. Horrible visit from beginning to end. And just to let you guys know, many people were upset about the restroom situation. My husband was not okay with me going to the restroom with men in the stall next to me. Guys were peeing outside of the restaurant bc they didnt want to use the bathroom with women as well. You will be reported.

Ok, I don't normally like to do chain restaurant places, but I have to give it up for TGIF.   One of the worst places ever.   I haven't been back there in probably 6 or 7 years for good reason:  The service is always terrible, the food is decent at best, and the price is way too much for my liking.  The last time I went was for my birthday.  Why there?  I have no idea; I didn't plan it.   We waited an hour to sit, and then after waiting about 45 minutes for our waiter to take our order, it took another hour for the food to get there.  So after almost four hours, my worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant was finally done.  The worst place ever, and I will NEVER go back.

I'm not really a big fan of restaurants like this...I'm sure if I was super super hungry and dying of starvation I would come eat here. But this place seems like a good place for people who LOVE extra greasy cheap food that come in portions that could feed a whole country, which I am not really a big fan of. It's definitely a good place for big groups to eat altogether. Too heavy for my own good.

I don't have much to say except that this place is evil. The food is evil and the servers are evil and the ambience is evil. I get this moody and absolutely depressed feeling whenever I'm forced to enter this place. It's probably because I ordered an appetizer and it took them about an hour and a half to actually serve me compared to the 15 minutes it took to eat the food. Don't get me wrong, that wasn't the first time I stepped into a T.G.I.F. In fact this was the "place" to have your birthday party in high school or middle school. Back then it was great because I wasn't paying for my own meal and I didn't know the difference between good food and bad unless it consisted of broccoli and cauliflowers. No, now that I have to taste my food with my money, I can reassure you that the experience here is less than mediocre. Evil, I say!

I've been to a few Friday's and this was by far the worst. I'm not a big fan of there food but that apps. are ok. The service here sucked. It took about 15-20 mins. to get a damn "hello, can I help you?". Then she left. WTF! Finally she came back about 10min. later. The only reason I stayed was because I was watching sports center. Yes, that whole Farve drama. SET HIM FREE! HaHa. Our host was way to busy talking to customers about school and bs. Before hand, they told us it was happy hour. We didn't drink much but we got the bill and it was regular prices. No freaken happy hour. All BS! Not a great place.  ; ^ D

This was the worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant! Everything that could have went wrong did. Let me start.... Me and my two friends wanted a drink and late night meal. We come in about 11:15 get seated at 11:30, there was no room at the bar so we ask the host if we can still get happy hour... she tells us yes.. So we get seated order off the happy hour menu... order more drinks ( thinking they would be $5 each) and are having a nice time... Then the server tells us that we can't have the happy hour special because we are not at the bar, but she will see what she can do. Um excuse me but we were told we were getting the 1/2 off that is why we only ordered items that were under that menu. So she never comes back to tell us "what she can do." A while passes we don't have the waters we ordered (it took 30 minutes to get water....) then my meal comes.. I start to eat, me and my friends are having a good time and the waitress comes up and takes our food ( my friends were done, but I still had half my meal).. I was not done, nor did she ask if I was done! She just took my plate with fries and 1/3 a burger on it... I do cover my food in ketchup but that is the way I like to eat it.... I don't think it would have been that hard to ask are you done with this since there was still 1/2 a meal on the plate! Then she brought our bill...We weren't given any discount. So we asked for a manager... none ever came but the hostess fixed the bill a bit... Then we gave our cards... and our more stripes card... well they lost our more stripes card... and the manager was supposed to come out but never did... This place will never get my money again. The service was horrible, the food was ok... but I felt like I really wasted my money on this place. Our drinks were never filled, our server rarely showed up... It took them 45 minutes to sort out the bill. We didn't end up leaving until 1:20am, but were ready to leave at 12:30... This was more than unacceptable!!!!!

The food is okay. They do have a big selection. You'll definitely have time to watch a game if you've ordered food because it takes forever. Even on days when the Clippers are playing it takes a long time (i.e. days when no one is really there... that's a joke folks).  However, the bartenders that have been there for a while are cool. So if you're looking to just drink... it's a cool place. The atmosphere is fun for a game. If you're looking to drink and munch I suggest you eat before you get there (not unless the Clippers are playing and you're not too hungry).

I have a love hate relationship with Fridays ! Love their food BUT HATE the service! I feel like Everytime we go the servers hate their job and give crappy to no service! Today was bad... Walked in and the hostess was not friendly than she asked us to wait 15 mins when it wasn't even busy... She brought us to the table that was half set up(missing place setting) and I went to put my son in the high chair and it was soooo dirty I had to pull out baby wipes to clean it before I could set my son in it! While she just stood there watching me(but didn't say or do anything) but our food was awesome.
Service was okay but the shrimp was so salty I really could not eat it.

My local watering hole. I love this restaurant. My friends and I can be found at the bar more times than I would like to admit. The reason being that they treat us so well here. The staff is friendly, attentive, and timely. I have never gotten an order that was wrong. Not to mention the food is great and reasonably priced. Gotta love the Jack's BBQ food items. To die for. I love the burgers and baby back ribs. One of th best BBQ sauces I have ever tried. Another great thing is their rewards card "Give me more stripes". Buy food get money back. Not a lot but it's better than nothing.

i don't expect much from a restaurant like fridays, so for me to take the time to give them 2 stars really means something.  bathrooms, suck.  service, mediocre.  food, edible.  children under 5, should be served 1st, this is common sense right?  they'll get no more of my $.  the 2 star is for the edible food only.

We came here not only for the AYCE shrimp, but for the happy hour! The shrimp was pretty damn salty, the saltiness that would make people want more water, meaning...less shrimp to gorge on. All this saltiness is definitely not healthy for ANYONE! that is -1 star. -2 star for a lack of better service (our server was awesome, until he switched out with a dreadful server who came by our table once throughout the span of 1 hour). -3 stars because I asked for a medium rare steak, but came out was a medium...
Don't cheers with their beer glasses. They break easily, very fragile & you can get wet.

i usually go to the TGIF in brea, but sometimes go to this one. sadly, this one isn't as clean or nice as the one in brea. it's definitely an older place, with a different crowd. the bar isn't very comfortable to sit at, but the service is usually good. i just like how i can expect the same food and drinks here that i find at the brea one. their happy hour deals is what brings me here, so for those prices, it's not a bad place to go with friends~

Good old TGI Friday's~ 1/15/09  While I consider TGIF a staple and franchised in almost every state, it actually makes me feel like I'm home.  I suppose it is because I worked there way back in 98 but, still feels nostalgic. Onion Soup - After trying all the TIGF soups, I recommend the Onion Soup, it is quite yummy. It would be hard to choose between this Onion Soup or the one at Mimi's Cafe. Jack Daniel Rib and Shrimp w/ fries - switched the fries for onion rings. The Shrimp was good but, the ribs tasted a little bit dry and not as soft and falling right off the bone as I would like.  The JD sauce did help. My Favorite: My favorite plate is the Blackened Chicken Alfredo (extra blackened).  I think the tomatoes and green onions add to the flavor!  Beware, it is a big serving so maybe split with someone else or take the rest to go. Obviously not a very health conscience choice but, yummy! Tropicana: basically a pina colada with strawberries, by far my favorite...maybe typical girl drink. But, great dessert! I noticed the service does take quite a while and we were waiting a bit until someone came to us.  It has happened whether it was busy or slow.

Happy Hour in the patio...not happy because you have the slowest service ever... But maybe because they were changing shifts and the gal was closing up to go home - the guy was a lot more attentive thereafter, though only because he was helping other tables and was therefore actually around for us to flag down when we needed him...but proactive - not so much.
All this place needs is a pinball machine......And it'll be a adult hangout P.S. Haven't tried the food here for a while.. so the review on the food here was for about 10 years ago FOOD = EH!!!

I really don't like Fridays anymore , but the price was awesome when I went this past Thursday after a fun day at Disneyland! I went with two other friends and our check was only $48.00 for happy hour. We ordered 3 appetizers and 8 drinks. Also received a free ice cream sundae for my birthday! I don't know if I will return, but it was an awesome price ans decent appetizers.

The reviews indicate one of the main problems with this place is the service. I agree. Perhaps they've just given up on good service because of the lousy tipping and obnoxious customers that I saw here. The wait staff may be burnt out, I don't know. The food is ok, but it's getting dirty in here and our table was a disaster. Long Beach Town Center is turning into a gangster hangout more and more, and TGI Fridays is as well. I think a major overhaul of this place is going to be required before it goes under. I hope it doesn't.

Wow... TGIF was once more like a 3 maybe 3.5 stars at few years ago.  Maybe 4 years ago actually. Now the service is horrible. The actual server is not bad, but so so slow. Even the hosting is slow, needs more training.  How many people does it take, to take a name when there is no line. And yet there was a wait list (took us 10 minutes to be seated after getting our name taken). Either the business that that bad so they're really understaffed, or someone doesn't care anymore. The last time I went there seemed to be 2 hostess? and maybe 3-4 servers just as servers, not in the bar area. And there plenty of empty tables. It took over 5 minutes to get the server to come over to ask for drinks. Another long while to get the drinks. But that's is still okay waiting time for me. After my order was taken, I find out my ice water was foul. It was really bad water, the tap tasted like the dentist. And it wasn't some faint aftertaste, it was really strong... My brother who was with me didn't believe me until I told him to drink it.  What he said was, "WOW," So I thought maybe I'll get some lemon. Waited more time to get the server's attention and ask for it. Didn't get the lemons for awhile, so when he came around again I just asked for an order of lemonade then. He came with lemonade and said it was on the house, and that there had been complaints about the water and such... The lemonade had the same aftertaste as the water, but it was more bearable. The food probably took 25+ minutes to get to our table. Which is a long time for a sandwich. And guess what... my burger and fries were luke-warm. The fries must have been at least 10 minutes old, and I would know. I love fries and work at a store that sells it.  It was at least 10 minutes old. And my burger was luke-warm but still good. But everything else was pretty disappointing. And I dislike TGIF's onion rings. It's looks like a wet battered onion ring, but whoever fries it... does a really bad job. And it's always kind of soggy. Sorry TGIF I know you can do much better. And BTW, I did tip that waiter. Around 20% still... he did try...

After a long morning sound of the border, we stopped here around 5p and sat in the bar area at a high table. It was super hot and humid yesterday but inside TGIF, it was freezing!! Our waitress had long, light hair and had major TUDE!! We moved to the counter because my goose bumps were the size of golfballs. We had wanted to sit out in the patio area but there were no umbrellas???? and it was sunny out there. My boyfriends mouth had been watering for the pork chops that are shown on the commercial so he ordered that. I had the quesadilla appetizer with chicken and sausage which was just ok. I had a beer and can't complain about that part. We waited sooooooo long for our food and when they set his plate on the table, I couldn't believe the measly portions. It looked like 1 scoop of mashed potatoes, a very small pork chop and 5 onion rings.. yes, you heard right... 5!!!!  and only 2 of them were large, the other 3 were super tiny. I gave him some of my food because there is no way that would fill up a hungry man. I asked the hostess if I could have a comment card because I really needed to leave some notes, well I had no clue she was going to call the manager!!! I laughed. I was honest and told him about the baby food portions and he says the food is pre-measured. I also mentioned our waitress needed some social skills. He really didn't seem fazed or interested so we left.. That is the first AND LAST time we step foot into that TGIF!!! Better yet, the last time in any TGIF or Applebees... I'll stick to my holes in the wall. I gave 1 star for the cold beer I had.

Go only if you feel like fried food.  I don't appreciate the noise level here.  I hate the clutter they use to decorate this place.  My boyfriend ordered a vodka lemonade for me but I didn't enjoy drinking something blue.  When I turned 21, my best friends took me here and the waitress tied balloons to my pigtails so they would float.

Service is good; there is one guy server that is probably the best we've had! He tried hard even before we left him a fat tip! All you complainers and winers about service, try TIPPING, it does wonders! I bet half of you leave 10-12% max which equals BAD service! Plus servers do remember you for one of two things, bad tip or good tip!

If you live in Cerritos and it's late at night and you don't want to drive too far, it really comes down to this place or BJs.  Personally, I prefer BJs because their beers are a lot better but even BJs can get old.  That's when I come here.  I've only had the appetizers and there's a couple things here that BJs doesn't have like the little Mac n Cheeses and deep fried green beans.  The nachos here a lot better too.  At BJs they dump chili on the whole thing.  Which wouldn't be so bad except there's beans in the chili, gross.

tgi nasty's? i know i'm being a bit on the biased side since this location was my first experience at tgi friday's. i would say this place would be similar to applebizzle? applebee's? you know. which isn't the best place to eat. maybe that's why i've never been here before? because nothing looked appetizing! hello!? fried green beans dipped in ranch or something like that!? give me a break. whatevs. anyway, i ordered some sort of pasta dish; the supposed future love of my life ordered some sort of special they had, and we shared an appetizer sampler. my pasta was gross. the special was mediocre. the sampler was the only thing that i could eat. actually, the potato skins and the celery dipped in ranch were the only things that i could eat. after that, i had a major upset stomach and i never came back to any location again. that's my story of tgi nasty's. our server was nice though, so that's a plus.
iLOVE the new york shrimp. DELICIOUS! french fries are super bomb as well. great food, okay service= four stars

Went there for my BFFs grad to celebrate.i ordered the smoked salmon for 14.ninty something basically 15bux..I was like ok it's a new dish must be bomb I don't mind 15 bucks ...but when I saw it I was like what the heck? Where the rest of it go!?SMALL portions people! Which is fine if you are trying to cut back but for a 15 dollar dish with 5pices of broccoli 4inch salmon and a few grains of rice I was like all hell no not worth it..I thought it was going to be like chillies or BJs where the prices are about the same but you get a descent size dish..nope not TGI ....and it tasted greasy and super dry when u try to swallow it,weird.Couldn't finish it ....my hubby and my BFF both got the boneless wings...they were so dissapointed too they got like 10 pieces of small wings lol dont u usually get like 20 ?it was so funny the look on their faces like are we getting punked? Who's hiding the rest? Lol....needless to say we were all left hungry:( so of course we had to order desert,it looked big On the pic and dilish.We all ordered the same brownie with the ice cream on top for about 6 dollars..it was really good but gosh again with the sample sizes! Little portions! Stingy mofos I swear !i should've gone to the funnel house in shoreline huge portion same price(of the brownie ice cream)...the staff was blah didn't come over to see how we were doing (I badly needed a refill on my strawberry lemonade from that dry salmon blah) had to look for waitress just to get service..took a while to bring our request..i think they were low on staff I swear there was a man in a suit passing treys I think he was a cook :/? Any ways this place is good for some drinks..food wise ehm no...not that tasty average ,expensive for the portion sizes they give...better off going to BJs,Boston's, or Chillis
hey a need 4 apetizers or drinks, friday's is the place to be at... @ cerritos town center. i truly recommend it.
awesome food, awesome location, the layout is pretty nice because of the big smoking patio. the service is always good at friday's but really awesome here.

When the girls and I or my high school crew want to go drink, stay local, chill outside, and eat a little, we come to TGI Fridays.  My girl works here so it's always a breeze. hahah I won't put her name because she might get in trouble.  I can see how people would hate this place though. There's always a long wait during the evenings. The wait can be impossible. The outside patio is fairly large and draws a lot of people to it so it always adds to the wait. There is another outside patio on the other side of the restaurant but they usually don't open it. It's like the step child patio. No one ever remembers it's there. Anywhoo. I like this particular location because my girl always gets us seated. I hate waiting and no I do not want to sit inside. It's too stuffy. We get a big table outside and put a whole bunch of chairs around it. We get great service and hard drinks. We act a fool, get loud and crazy, make friends outside, and have a blast. What more can you ask for? One thing though. I wish I would stop running into people I knew from back in the day here. UGH! Can't people go somewhere else? hahaha... all good though. :)

Better than average Friday's.  These guys have happy hour all day Sunday with NFL ticket ... yeah!!! Love football with half price app's.  Karaoke on Tuesday nites outside is a lot of fun and it would be better if they would have happy hour all day on Tuesdays as well.  Happy hour starts at 10PM and the Karaoke starts at 9:00 and that sucks ... wasted hour. Food was good.  Flat iron steak is a hit.
The food here tastes like a frozen meal.  I had the mahi mahi fish and got food poisoning.   Will NOT be back here.

So, I signed up for a yelp account over a year ago and never wrote any reviews.. just used and abused you guys for info on yummy eats( don't hate me yet)..but felt it was finally time to write my first review. I thought about it for awhile.. what would be the place that would take my yelp review virginity? *snaps fingers* TGI Fridayyyys!!! I know I know, wtf her favorite place is TGIF's?! but to me its not just the food, it's the memories~  Sure the service sucks and I have been tempted to leave a jalepeno as a tip numerous times, but the reason TGI's will always top my list of fav places to eat..is "the perfect meal." When I was in high school my friend and I would come here almost on a weekly basis and order the same thing which we named " the perfect meal" .. it consisted of the blackened chicken alfredo, jack daniel's sesame chicken strips, a side salad with honey mustard dressing and an extra breadstick so we could each get our own, oh and always always "can we get some jalepenos please?" JUST TRY IT. This meal is so good, it will change your life.. k maybe not ur life, but I guarantee it will make your day so much better. Back in the day after this meal we would walk our fat a$$es to Helen grace and get 1 meltaway ( and 1 free chocolate) hahahah  but helen grace isn't there anymore so you'll have to go elsewhere for dessert.. =)

I come here all the time with my boyfriend, its our favorite restaurant to go to for either lunch or dinner, I've never had any issues here so there is nothing to complain about, I love their lobster macaroni dish, as far as cocktails their "electric lemonade" is the best..  Service is exceptional, our waiters have always checked on us at least 5 times.. I will continue being a loyal customer here =)

We had a fun time chilling at the bar!  Pretty safe for 2 girls on a Saturday night.  We had a few drinks and munched on the yummy fried green beans!  Hey, still getting my daily servings of veggies!  :-) Mr. Bartender was a little too friendly and touchy but he was cool and didn't overstep his bounds too much!

HORRIBLE SERVICE. we get seated and wait for literally 10 minutes before anyone comes to our table. The The male waiter finally comes to take our drink order. We order appetizers. I got the boneless wings and my girlfriend got the mozzarella sticks. I specifically asked for ranch to be delivered with my wings. During this time we got no refills. (Which is very frustrating seems how it was 20 minutes before our food came out). Then the appetizers come out and I don't have ranch and so it takes another 10 minutes to flag down our waiter for ranch!!!!! R U KIDDING ME! So here comes our entrees now and they drop it off and walk away (still no refills). Now we do not have silverware to eat with either! So some lady comes and brings my girlfriends refill ( she has coke ans I have water)...and completely disregards my need for a refill! HORRIBLE SERVICE! I WI BE TELLIng EVERYONE ABOUT THIS PLACE! This is the last dime I spend here!!!!! So we waited an additional 23 minutes for the check (literally counted)..wow. The food was cold and The manager( black shirt and pants) was leaning against the reception stand the whole ti.e instead of helping servers. Will be calling corporate offices. Lukas was our server.

Being a regular here I have myself a stripes reward card as known as the 'frequent drinker card'. I always find myself asking this question why won't other bars offer competitive hh prices like TGIF and have hh every night at 10pm to close? And on Monday and Tuesdays, half off on all bottles of wine all day. Whose going to beat that? And karaoke and disco nights on Monday/Tuesday. And always cool waiter and waitress. Apply for stripes reward card and get yourself free appetizer and buy 1 get 1 entree coupons.

Although we usually like the food here, what I really love is the service.  Everytime we've been here we've been very pleasantly surprised by the staff.  This last time we went was no different.  Our waiter Joe gave great service throughout our meal.  One of my kids really like cherrys and so Joe put about 8 cherrys on top of his smoothy.  When the bill came, he told us there was a special price on one our dishes and gave us a $5 discount on it.  As it turned out, we also had one of those fake coupons (we honestly didn't know it was) and even though it was posted on the front door as being such (which we didn't see, since they opened the door for us), the manager still gave us the Buy 1 Get 1 Free.  Because of our mistake, he decided to give us a free desert up to $8 (which is pretty much all of their fancy stuff). So in the end, we had a great meal, with great service, and got out with a really great price.. It's very rare that we find another restaurant who gives us similar service, but we do often find it here.

for cinco de mayo they had this really cool deal going on-- it was like "five cent appetizers with the purchase of a drink". without having to be convinced any further, my friend and i were already in the car driving down to our local fridays.  as we walked through the door, the hostess just ignored us. we figured that we would just sit at the bar because it was around happy hour, but she didnt even acknowledge us or let us know if we can just sit anywhere. so we politely asked her if we just sit anywere, and she rudely replied back as if were were annoying her. we sat down, and waited. and waited, and waited-- finally a server comes up to our table, we asked him about the cinco de mayo special and he took our order. all seemed well i guess, until some of our food never showed up at our table-- so we told the server to just nevermind some of the food, we just want our check. he brings the check but he charged us for the food we never got. we let him know, and he hands us another check-- except this one is wrong too, he forgot the promotion and didnt charge us correctly because its happy hour-- so we give him back the check again. after the fourth try, we finally had the bill straightened out-- and i finally had my opinion about this TGIF straightened out too.  the worst service & they cant do the math! try another fridays-- like LB town center-- just not this one in cerritos.

Came here with a couple of friends and we had a great time.  Our server was really fun and was quick with our orders.  Nice and spcaious inside with lots of seating, but then again we came during non-busy hours.  Again, service was exceptional as our server really took care of us.  Recommended.

I really want to give this a better rating, but I just can't. I'm always torn when I go to TGIF because I've never come across really good food. Everything is usually mediocre. Though the sizzling parmesean chicken was actually not bad at all. Our waitress was also pretty awesome for having to take care of party of ~20.  Don't order drop shots from here. I ordered a jager bomb, and they poured the jager right into the red bull before giving it to me. I don't know why  they couldn't give me two glasses to do this shot properly. I was ordering it for the birthday boy, so I had to walk it from the bar back to the table. The reason jager bombs are good is when you drink it  the moment its mixed together. Not that big of a deal, but still annoying.  So what made this rating go down so much was because they flat-out lied. I ordered an all-american mojito, which instead of rum you have bourbon. When they came around with the drinks, they were here's a mojito. No one else at the table had ordered a mojito, so I said something, but I said I ordered an all-american. He was like this is it. I was like, but I didn't order a regular mojito. Regular mojitos are a greenish color, which this one was. Now, to my knowledge bourbon is a brownish color, so shouldn't the drink have been brownish? He kept insisting this was it, and I kept questioning how could it be. He took it back, but a minute later, a different waitress brought "my" drink, which I swear was the same one he just took back. She was like, this is the all-american. I asked, is there bourbon in here? She was like yes. I try it, no hint of bourbon at all and bourbon is a pretty distinct taste. I was about to complain, but my friend was like, "dont worry about it," to the waitress. I was a little annoyed at him. He was like, "they're stingy about their alcohol." I was like, I would understand if it was weak, but they got the wrong drink! I like mojitos, but if I wanted a regular one then I wouldn't be ready to raise hell about it. Two of my other friends tried it too and confirmed that there was no bourbon. So I guess here at TGIF they think bourbon is clear.
Kids eat free Monday and Tuesday.  I had the Jack Daniel steak - you can skip it - the sauce was not tasty at all and the extra calories (compared to the regular steak) is not worth it at all.
Great wings, sauce too tame music too loud, but service is good

my friends and i decided to sit down for happy hour drinks and specials. and let me tell you that we just walked in on the wrong night for that.It was karoke night and man not only did the food suck but the music did too. Stay away from karoke night......

Fuck this place! if i could give it 0 stars, i would horrible service, long waits and usually filled with large parties of kids trying to get their friends wasted.  After tooooooo many bad experiences (poor service, long waits, long waits for food, getting the wrong order) here, i refuse to dump anymore money into this shitty establishment.

happy hour = half off on appetizers and cheap drinks from 3-7pm, 10-close and all day sunday! 2 for $20 deal = pretty good selection. they used to have the prime rib pasta included in the deal but they changed it.. that was bomb! try their bruschetta chicken pasta, it's pretty good. pepper crusted porkchop isn't bad either. service has always been ok... there have been a couple times that it was slow and stuff but that's ok... that's pretty much understandable during prime time. some servers are friendly but others just look too lazy or too damn sick and tired or of working there. uhmm, hello... can we get a smile? their busboys are cool tho... friendly and very polite. :) the bartenders are cool too and always made the drinks right. i'm always glad to see the lady manager there... she's very empathetic the past two times i had a complaint and mind that i say she really made sure everything was ok by talking with our server and comping/discounting our tab... very good service! :) anyways, i really didn't wanna write a review about this restaurant until our experience earlier (sunday afternoon). we just had the worst time there. we came in and told the hostess that we'll sit at the bar. usually they'll bring the menus to the table... about 5 minutes in, there were no menus on our table. the 2 hostesses and 1 host were just there chit chatting and watching the game. our server, tim, came by and took our drink order. I asked him for menus. another 10 minutes passed by, still no menu. we were watching him the whole time and he was just going to every table (which was fine), talking to his co-workers, and  also watching the game. really, how hard is it to grab a menu and continue on with whatever you're doing? IT WAS NOT EVEN BUSY. so, I had to ask another server for the menu. tim didn't take our orders until we hunted him down which led on to another 15 minutes all because he was busy watching the game. the manager on the floor was not doing his job either!! he sat down with the group next to us. terrible, terrible, terrible... just terrible!! i really love this place for their happy hour but the fact that we were treated like that earlier just pissed me off. idk if it's because it was raining all day or what, but tgif's HR, please do some evaluation on your staff... maybe re-train them? So 3 stars for yesterday's experience. UGH.

Well i came here a couple of days ago and the place was big. The server i had was okay. The flat iron i had that day was not so good. I have had better at another tgif. Maybe it was a different chef or something. I don't like that fact that when i order a salad they barely put any ranch on it and that i didn't have any utensils when i came. But one thing i love the most was the mash potatoes.

Our family goes here all the time but this night it started off bad I could see from all the people waiting outside it was going to be a wait when I walked in I seen quite a few  empty seats in the dining area but some reason people were still waiting to be called. I put in our name and went to the first come first serve bar area to wait with my kids till they called. After 5 min a hostess came over and told me the seat I was in was reserved and I had to leave I told her this area is first come first serve and she said the booth I was sitting in was for two people and there was four of us. I told her it didn't matter there was no where else for us to sit and we were only sitting there till we were called. I didn't like how we were being treated so I walked out with my kids so mad not wanting to make a scene with my kids I told the hostess to cross off my name party of 9. Went to Woodranch a few restaurants away and received excellent service spent $230.00 there well worth it. Disappointed in Friday's training needed in customer service.. I gave it no stars!!

So, I really don't expect a whole lot from a Friday's.  But I guess the one in Compton has spoiled me so I expect the service and the food to be at least that good now. I have met friends and my hubby there for lunch 3 times in the past couple of  months.  The first time they got the order wrong on my friend's salad. For gosh sakes how do you get a salad order wrong?  But I chalked it up to new waitress or new cook. The next time I met Hubby there, they were remodeling.  They seated us right away then it took quite a while for them to take out order. I veered off my normal order and got some kind of pasta.  I couldn't even eat it, it tasted so bad.  But I sucked it up and wrote it off to me being picky.  I have their promotional "Stripes" card, but their machine was broken.  I thought fine, they're re-modeling, cut them some slack. Last time (and I mean really the last time for this TGIF*ed me over), I was seated and ordered drinks for all three in my party.  The other 2 showed up with in 10 minutes, maybe less, it was just after she set the drinks on the table.  Then we waited.  And Waited.  After 10 minutes of not seeing the waitress, we went up to the host/hostesses and asked if they could find her for us, we waited an ADDITIONAL 10 minutes with no one else checking on us.  She finally brought the table next to us their food and we let her know we were ready to order, she actually said, "Just give me a sec." and disappeared for another 3 minutes!  I was ready to go, but my friends didn't want fast food.  So we gave our order, the food was even worse than last time and the Stripes Card machine was still not working!  When we asked for a manager, we were told he was too busy could we wait about 5 minutes?  UNBELIEVABLE! On an up-note, Hubby and I just ate at the one in the Compton Gateway Center and the waitress was great, the food actually tasted like food and we were in and out in a reasonable amount of time.
